input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

[2] Name: The Nickel Samurai
Description: A glossy photo Maya pushed onto me. A picture describing the nickel samurai costume.

[3] Name: Press Conference Ticket
Description: Seems like the Nickel Samurai is to confess something after the post-ceremony stage show.

[4] Name: Radio Transceiver
Description: Originally from the Bellboy. It can transmit and receive signals over great distances. Originally from Maya's kidnapper, who goes by the name of "De Killer".

[5] Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: A very expensive item valued at $1,600. It was stolen around the time of the murder. Stolen on the night of the murder. Tabloid article about the victim was in the case.

[6] Name: Hotel Guidemap
Description: Map of the Gatewater Hotel around the crime scene. A path from the west leads to the viola hall. To the north of the path is engarde and to the south corrida. East of viola hall is the lobby.

[7] Name: Guitar Case
Description: Found next to the victim. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Bears only Corrida's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Wine Glass
Description: Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. No sign it's been drank. Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. Bears Andrews' fingerprints.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: Photo of Juan Corrida's murder scene. [caption] The victim sits on a chair in a samurai outfit. There is a knife sticking out of his chest. A glass of juice sits behind him on the dresser. A full bottle of juice sits on the desk in front of him. An open guitar case lies on the floor next to him. Next to the guitar case are the remains of a smashed vase that has stained the carpet with water.

[10] Name: Autograph
Description: Juan Corrida's autograph. "To my dearest Wendy" is written on it.

[11] Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An "article" from the tabloid "Gossip Land". The contents of the article follow: *Jammin' Midnight Rendezvous!?*

A super-star in an ultra-hot, mega-secret
love scandal!?

Reliable sources say that Juan Corrida
has been getting in close with the
mysterious, yet beautiful manager to the
stars, Ms. A.A.!


[12] Name: Suicide Report
Description: Deceased: Celeste InpaxFound by: Juan CorridaWas her suicide note hidden?

[13] Name: Attempted Suicide Report
Description: Attempter: Adrian AndrewsReason: Shock from Celeste Inpax's suicide.

[14] Name: Juan's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 8:15 PMCause: Strangled to death with a scarf, then stabbed with a knife.

[15] Name: Knife
Description: Bears the victim's blood and Engarde's fingerprints. In the grip, "Gatewater" is engraved.

[16] Name: Jammin' Ninja's Button
Description: Was ripped from his costume. Is covered in Corrida's blood. Found in Engarde's "hakama".

[17] Name: Lotta's Photo
Description: Picture taken in the Hallway right after the murder. A person in samurai garb stands outside the door.

[18] Name: Picture Card
Description: Was placed next to the victim at the time of the murder. Ms. Andrews was carrying it.

[19] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: Received from Edgeworth. Allows bearer to freely investigate the crime scene.

[20] Name: Matt's Note
Description: "Please feed my cat, Shoe. My house is just a little ways down from the hotel."

[21] Name: Spy Camera
Description: Set to record the victim's room from 8 PM for 1 hour. Was running at time of murder.

[22] Name: Transmitter
Description: Changes the footage taken by the spy camera into radio waves and transmits the data.

[23] Name: Stuffed Bear
Description: The spy camera was set in its right eye. Found in the victim's room.

[24] Name: Credit Card Receipt
Description: A receipt for $3,800. Proof Engarde bought a stuffed bear identical to one in evidence.

[25] Name: Figurine
Description: A wooden bear-shaped figurine. It's covered in many thin cuts. A wooden puzzle with a hollow inside. Only Corrida and Andrews know how to open it.

[26] Name: Celeste's Photo
Description: Found at Engarde Mansion. "With Love... Celeste" is written on it.

[27] Name: Celeste's Suicide Note
Description: Found inside the Figurine. It tells of Engarde's horrible misdeeds.

[28] Name: Pistol
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> A small caliber pistol that is thought to have been fired by De Killer at Franziska.

[29] Name: Video Tape
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> One of the items retrieved. De Killer violently tried to recover it. Contents unknown.

[30] Name: Bellboy's Uniform
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.<if asked for details> Worn by De Killer on the night of the murder. One of its special buttons is missing.

[31] Name: Whip
Description: Thrown away by Franziska von Karma, it has a certain mysterious nostalgia to it.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Matt Engarde and Juan Corrida were huge rivals with each other.
[1] Testimony: They each thought the other guy was "in his way". That's motive enough in my book.
[2] Testimony: As for evidence... There's the Jammin' Ninja's button.
[3] Testimony: It was ripped off of the ninja costume and was found in Mr. Engarde's "hakama".
[4] Testimony: The defendant's fingerprints were also all over the knife.
[5] Testimony: The defendant bought the knife for the crime... Which makes this a premeditated murder!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
Detective Gumshoe explains why the defendant was convicted.
input.suffix: Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Anyway, after the ceremony, I went to pace around in the hallway in front of his room.
[1] Testimony: There was something I was interested in finding out, you know...
[2] Testimony: Well, since I was on the job, I made sure to keep a good eye out the whole time.
[3] Testimony: That's when someone showed up! It was a man coming out of poor Juan's room.
[4] Testimony: It was Engarde. Matt Engarde. He was trying to sneak his way out of Juan's room!
[5] Testimony: He was wearing his flashy racing jacket. Honestly, it's all just for show.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Oldbag describes what she saw outside the room of Juan, the victim. She claims to have seen Matt Engarde, the defendant, sneaking out of the room.

[0] Testimony: It was time for the show to start, so I went to get Matt from his room.
[1] Testimony: After that, I went to Juan's room.
[2] Testimony: And there was his dead body. I... I was in shock...

[4] Testimony: I felt as though I was about to faint, so I poured myself a glass of juice.
[5] Testimony: I was the one who knocked the flower vase over, where it fell onto the guitar case.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: From the moment I saw the crime scene, I had a feeling that Matt was the murderer.
[1] Testimony: Matt had to kill Juan no matter what.
[2] Testimony: I know what his motive was. ...But I don't have any way to prove I'm right.
[3] Testimony: And he didn't have an alibi for what he was doing at the time of the murder.
[4] Testimony: My thoughts were confirmed by the evidence, of course; the button and the knife...
[5] Testimony: That button was torn off of Juan during his fight with Matt.
[6] Testimony: But I'm Matt's manager... So I felt that I had to protect him...

The witness Andrews explains why she believes her client Matt was the killer of Juan.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: That glass of juice... I didn't really pour it for myself.
[1] Testimony: I was surprised when I walked into the room and saw it in that messy state.
[2] Testimony: And Juan... He was sitting slumped over and tired-looking in the corner.
[3] Testimony: When I saw him sitting like that, the thought that he was dead didn't cross my mind.
[4] Testimony: To be honest, I thought he had just fainted or something. So I went to pour him some juice.
[5] Testimony: When I realized that he was dead... That's when I knocked the flower vase over.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Andrews explains why she didn't think the victim was dead when she found him.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The beach hut was made of shoddy old reed screens, so there were plenty of gaps I could see inside through.
[1] Testimony: The Englishwoman was sitting on a stool when the student girl came in and started arguing with her.
[2] Testimony: Seconds later, the girl pulled out a knife, throwing the Englishwoman to the floor as she stabbed her in the back!
[3] Testimony: My smouldering journo spirit burst into flames! Quick as a flash, I whipped out my camera ready to click!
[4] Testimony: I pulled apart the rough weave of one of the screens and poked the lens through for the perfect shot.
[5] Testimony: I never once set foot in the hut, nor spoke with the Englishwoman. I was there only as an observer.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Oh yes, I stabbed the Englishwoman. And it's that very fact that proves I'm innocent!
[1] Testimony: Because why would I have bothered to stab the woman if I'd already poisoned her?
[2] Testimony: When I heard the student girl and that pompous English murderer arguing...it got my goat.
[3] Testimony: It was nothing to do with Dr Wilson! We were discussing the stolen poison.
[4] Testimony: If the courts weren't going to punish Brett for what she did, someone else would have to see justice done!
[5] Testimony: The point is...if you'd poisoned someone, there'd be no reason to then go and stab the person as well!

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.

[2] Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded. 

[3] Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow.

[4] Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.

[5] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.

[6] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.

[7] Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.

[8] Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.

[9] Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.

[10] Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.

[11] Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.

[12] Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing.

[13] Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.

[14] Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.

[15] Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.

[16] Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago. [info] Condemned Prisoner 
 ***** (Redacted for confidentiality) 
 Pseudonym: The Professor 
 Ddeath by hanging confirmed at midnight, 17th June. 
 Courtney Stevens. 

[17] Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion. [caption] There is blood traces dripping down from the chest towards abdomen. 

[18] Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.

[19] Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The special exhibit in the House of Horrors is based on a rumour that shocked society in London.
[1] Testimony: An impression of the visage was taken directly from the corpse...in accordance with Tusspells family principles.
[2] Testimony: I enlisted the aid of the gravedigger, and created a mould for the head in the cemetery just before the interment.
[3] Testimony: I hid myself until he gave me a signal. ...I was there for a very long time that night.
[4] Testimony: It took me a very long time because it was before the onset of rigor mortis.
[5] Testimony: As dawn approached, I was very worried that I could be discovered.
[6] Testimony: I hurried to finish my work in the half hour before sunrise. Then I left as soon as the corpse was interred.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Tusspells is testifying about how did she take the wax impression of the Professor's visage.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.

[2] Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded. 

[3] Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow.

[4] Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.

[5] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.

[6] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.

[7] Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.

[8] Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.

[9] Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.

[10] Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.

[11] Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.

[12] Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing.

[13] Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.

[14] Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.

[15] Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.

[16] Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago. [info] Condemned Prisoner 
 ***** (Redacted for confidentiality) 
 Pseudonym: The Professor 
 Ddeath by hanging confirmed at midnight, 17th June. 
 Courtney Stevens. 

[17] Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion. [caption] There is blood traces dripping down from the chest towards abdomen. 

[18] Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.

[19] Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The reason I was in Lowgate Cemetery at all ten years ago was for...a spot of moonlighting, shall we say?
[1] Testimony: Yes, the illustration in that newspaper article was based on what I witnessed that night.
[2] Testimony: Thinking back now, I realise that I never actually saw the Professor at all, though.
[3] Testimony: What I in fact witnessed, was a fellow graverobber at work.
[4] Testimony: There was no gunshot from behind me at all. Nor any splattering blood.
[5] Testimony: Soon afterwards, I was visited by a young woman who sculpted a model of me from wax.
[6] Testimony: Then I gave up on my dream of becoming a scientist. And it was all because of that newspaper article.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. It's brand-new and sparkles in the light.

[1] Name: Valerie's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed with a knife in the back. Died from blood loss between 4 and 5 PM.

[2] Name: Dusky Bridge Map
Description: Bridge located 40 feet above Eagle River. [caption] The bridge is broken midway towards the east. It connects to the parking lot towards the west. The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks. Under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed.

[3] Name: Victim's Note
Description: Confidential police materials written by the victim. [info] 

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.

[4] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the trunk of Fawles's car. [caption] The victim appears to be dead, curled up in the trunk. She was wearing a coat and no scarf. The coat is dry and clean. The trunk opener appears to be tampered.

[5] Name: Scarf
Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.

[6] Name: Witness's Photo
Description: Seems to have been taken by the witness. Click here for details. Taken by the witness. Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.

[7] Name: Camera
Description: Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. A small but powerful model. Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. Has a timer function.

[8] Name: Diamond
Description: A 2 million dollar gem. Used as ransom for Dahlia. Lost to Eagle River 5 years ago.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: On the day of the incident, an unknown person phoned the sergeant and asked to meet.
[1] Testimony: Sergeant Hawthorne went to Dusky Bridge at the designated time and met with Mr. Fawles.
[2] Testimony: And that's where she was brutally murdered, sir.
[3] Testimony: The criminal stuffed her body into his car trunk and tried to make a getaway.
[4] Testimony: Here's a photo of the trunk. But I don't see anything strange, do you? Anyway...
[5] Testimony: Mr. Fawles was arrested at a police checkpoint we set up at the base of the mountain.
input.summarized_context:

[0] Testimony: I... I was out of the country until the year before last.

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Five years ago, I was kidnapped by Mr. Fawles.
[1] Testimony: The ransom price was a raw diamond. My sister, Valerie, brought it to the bridge...
[2] Testimony: After she made the exchange, she shot Mr. Fawles in the arm!
[3] Testimony: That's when Mr. Fawles tried to kill me by shoving me off the bridge from behind!
[4] Testimony: I survived, but I was afraid I might be kidnapped again for my family's money...
[5] Testimony: So I decided to change my identity and start a new life...

Description: Bridge located 40 feet above Eagle River. [caption] The bridge is broken midway towards the east. It connects to the parking lot towards the west. The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks. Under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed.

[3] Name: Victim's Note
Description: Confidential police materials written by the victim. [info] 

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.

[4] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the trunk of Fawles's car. [caption] The victim appears to be dead, curled up in the trunk. She was wearing a coat and no scarf. The coat is dry and clean. The trunk opener appears to be tampered.

[5] Name: Scarf
Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.

[6] Name: Witness's Photo
Description: Seems to have been taken by the witness. Click here for details. Taken by the witness. Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.

[7] Name: Camera
Description: Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. A small but powerful model. Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. Has a timer function.

[8] Name: Diamond
Description: A 2 million dollar gem. Used as ransom for Dahlia. Lost to Eagle River 5 years ago.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: That day... 4 PM... I stopped the car. I was in front of bridge...
[1] Testimony: She wasn't there... So, I waited on bridge.
[2] Testimony: I watched my car from bridge. I never put no body in that car!
[3] Testimony: Finally, one woman came. She stood front of me.
[4] Testimony: We talked... Then she left.
[5] Testimony: That was... That was Valerie. Not my Dahlia!

Summarized context:
The prisoner Fawles is testifying about his meeting with the victim, Valerie Hawthorne.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.

[2] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

[3] Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.

[4] Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.

[5] Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.

[6] Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 

[7] Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.

[8] Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.

[9] Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.

[10] Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.

[11] Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.

[12] Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.

[13] Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.

[14] Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.

[15] Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.

[16] Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.

[17] Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.

[18] Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.
[1] Testimony: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.
[2] Testimony: As you can see, it's covered in blood.
[3] Testimony: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.
input.summarized_context:

Detective Gumshoe is testifying about the incriminating evidence against Maya Fey, which is her costume she was wearing.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

[2] Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

[3] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

[4] Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

[5] Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

[6] Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

[7] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

[8] Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

[9] Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

[10] Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

[11] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

[12] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

[13] Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

[14] Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

[15] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head. [Caption] There is no other wound and bruiseing on the body other than the shot.

[16] Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

[17] Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

[18] Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.

[19] Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

[20] Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

[21] Name: Passport
Description: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.

[22] Name: Klint's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson. The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.

[23] Name: Iris's Lucky Charm
Description: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...

[24] Name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
Description: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.

[25] Name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
Description: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.

[26] Name: Small Component
Description: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. It's now clear that it's the missing 'crown' of Inspector Gregson's pocket watch. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining anywhere on this evidence, then the tip on Gregson's Pocket Watch before the former evidence is specifically presented in court. However, this method still occurs in Story Mode.)

[27] Name: Telegram from Japan
Description: A telegram from Inspector Hosonaga in Japan with details of the telegram he managed to locate by stealing into Judge Jigoku's office.

[28] Name: Mr Asogi's Ring
Description: A ring belonging to Genshin Asogi found in Lord Klint van Zieks's stomach during the autopsy. The claws clasping the gem look sharp enough to cause a very nasty scratch.

[29] Name: Klint van Zieks's Will
Description: The last will and testament of Lord Klint van Zieks that has been hidden inside the great sword Karuma for years. A trump card left behind by Genshin Asogi.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: We saw the whole thing from start to finish, we did. Everything from the moment they went in the building.
[1] Testimony: It was less than a minute after the Reaper had gone inside that we all 'eard a big bang.
[2] Testimony: Seems to m-me that quick-to-talk is quick-to-walk. Gossip couldn't wait to go and see what had happened.
[3] Testimony: I ran into the room and there he woz. The Reaper, gun in hand, standin' over the dead body!
[4] Testimony: I slipped over and got blood on my hand, so I quickly wiped it off on the floor.
[5] Testimony: I was scared 'alf to death, me. So I ran off to find a copper.

input.full_input:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

[2] Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

[3] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

[4] Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

[5] Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

[6] Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

[7] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

[8] Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

[9] Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

[10] Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

[11] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

[12] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

[13] Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

[14] Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

[15] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head. [Caption] There is no other wound and bruiseing on the body other than the shot.

[16] Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

[17] Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

[18] Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.

[19] Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

[20] Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

[21] Name: Passport
Description: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.

[22] Name: Klint's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson. The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.

[23] Name: Iris's Lucky Charm
Description: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...

[24] Name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
Description: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.

[25] Name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
Description: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.

[26] Name: Small Component
Description: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. It's now clear that it's the missing 'crown' of Inspector Gregson's pocket watch. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining anywhere on this evidence, then the tip on Gregson's Pocket Watch before the former evidence is specifically presented in court. However, this method still occurs in Story Mode.)

[27] Name: Telegram from Japan
Description: A telegram from Inspector Hosonaga in Japan with details of the telegram he managed to locate by stealing into Judge Jigoku's office.

[28] Name: Mr Asogi's Ring
Description: A ring belonging to Genshin Asogi found in Lord Klint van Zieks's stomach during the autopsy. The claws clasping the gem look sharp enough to cause a very nasty scratch.

[29] Name: Klint van Zieks's Will
Description: The last will and testament of Lord Klint van Zieks that has been hidden inside the great sword Karuma for years. A trump card left behind by Genshin Asogi.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: We saw the whole thing from start to finish, we did. Everything from the moment they went in the building.
[1] Testimony: It was less than a minute after the Reaper had gone inside that we all 'eard a big bang.
[2] Testimony: Seems to m-me that quick-to-talk is quick-to-walk. Gossip couldn't wait to go and see what had happened.
[3] Testimony: I ran into the room and there he woz. The Reaper, gun in hand, standin' over the dead body!
[4] Testimony: I slipped over and got blood on my hand, so I quickly wiped it off on the floor.
[5] Testimony: I was scared 'alf to death, me. So I ran off to find a copper.

The witness Gossip, Venus, and Sandwich are testifying about the events they witnessed on Fresno Street.

[0] Testimony: We 'ad more zan one thousand red-'eaded people assemble in ze park on Lime Street zat day.
[1] Testimony: But I don't recall the man in this-a photograph. Ay, capo?
[2] Testimony: Non, I don't remember 'im. Obviously 'e is dead now. But I assure you, 'e was not in ze park.
[3] Testimony: Allora! This victim is-a nothing to do with us!
[4] Testimony: You 'ave a lot to answer for, Peppino. It is your fault zat we got caught in ze first place.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness De Rousseau and De Rossi are testifying about the events that took place in the park on Lime Street, where a large crowd of red-headed people gathered.
input.suffix: Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
input.full_input:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

[2] Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

[3] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

[4] Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

[5] Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

[6] Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

[7] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

[8] Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

[9] Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

[10] Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

[11] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

[12] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

[13] Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

[14] Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

[15] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head. [Caption] There is no other wound and bruiseing on the body other than the shot.

[16] Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

[17] Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

[18] Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.

[19] Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

[20] Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

[21] Name: Passport
Description: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.

[22] Name: Klint's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson. The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.

[23] Name: Iris's Lucky Charm
Description: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...

[24] Name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
Description: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.

[25] Name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
Description: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.

[26] Name: Small Component
Description: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. It's now clear that it's the missing 'crown' of Inspector Gregson's pocket watch. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining anywhere on this evidence, then the tip on Gregson's Pocket Watch before the former evidence is specifically presented in court. However, this method still occurs in Story Mode.)

[27] Name: Telegram from Japan
Description: A telegram from Inspector Hosonaga in Japan with details of the telegram he managed to locate by stealing into Judge Jigoku's office.

[28] Name: Mr Asogi's Ring
Description: A ring belonging to Genshin Asogi found in Lord Klint van Zieks's stomach during the autopsy. The claws clasping the gem look sharp enough to cause a very nasty scratch.

[29] Name: Klint van Zieks's Will
Description: The last will and testament of Lord Klint van Zieks that has been hidden inside the great sword Karuma for years. A trump card left behind by Genshin Asogi.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: We 'ad more zan one thousand red-'eaded people assemble in ze park on Lime Street zat day.
[1] Testimony: But I don't recall the man in this-a photograph. Ay, capo?
[2] Testimony: Non, I don't remember 'im. Obviously 'e is dead now. But I assure you, 'e was not in ze park.
[3] Testimony: Allora! This victim is-a nothing to do with us!
[4] Testimony: You 'ave a lot to answer for, Peppino. It is your fault zat we got caught in ze first place.

Summarized context:
The witness De Rousseau and De Rossi are testifying about the events that took place in the park on Lime Street, where a large crowd of red-headed people gathered.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Ze, ze truth is, we took 'im prisoner and kept 'im for ze night at our secret 'ideout.
[1] Testimony: Even though I didn't sink 'e was a real detective, I, I was too scared to let 'im go zat day, just in case.
[2] Testimony: We took the man's identification from him and shut-a him in the room next to ours!
[3] Testimony: Zere might 'ave been a little tussle, but we did 'im no 'arm. And ze next mornin', we let 'im go.
[4] Testimony: He tried to escape, but the capo put-a the collare on him and dragged him back...like what he did-a to me, see?
[5] Testimony: He spent-a the night in a nice room! It was-a nothing like prison really! Uèèèèèè!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness De Rousseau and De Rossi are testifying about the events that took place in their hideout, where they claim to have taken Inspector Gregson prisoner for the night.

You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

[2] Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

[3] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

[4] Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

[5] Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

[6] Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

[7] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

[8] Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

[9] Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

[10] Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

[11] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

[12] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

[13] Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

[14] Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

[15] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head. [Caption] There is no other wound and bruiseing on the body other than the shot.

[16] Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

[17] Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

[18] Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.

[19] Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

[20] Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

[21] Name: Passport
Description: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.

[22] Name: Klint's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson. The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.

[23] Name: Iris's Lucky Charm
Description: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...

[24] Name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
Description: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.

[25] Name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
Description: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.

[26] Name: Small Component
Description: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Map
Description: Shows the area around Mr. Wright's office. Click here for details.

[2] Name: Bowl
Description: Custom-made Eldoon's Noodles bowl. Decorated with the Eldoon's Noodles mascot.

[3] Name: Slippers
Description: Slippers for patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Slippers used by patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Big toe print found in left slipper.

[4] Name: Mirror
Description: Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Fits car at the Meraktis Clinic.

[5] Name: Cell Phone
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Who could have dropped it? Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Property of Wesley Stickler.

[6] Name: Trucy's Panties
Description: Prop for performing magic. Found in exhaust pipe of a car at the Meraktis Clinic.

[7] Name: Letter of Request
Description: Letter of request from Alita Tiala for the legal defense of her fiancé, Wocky Kitaki.

[8] Name: White Powder → Fingerprint Powder
Description: Mysterious white powder with the alleged ability to improve Detective Skye's mood. A memento of Wright and Skye. Examine fingerprints to detect and match prints.

[9] Name: Bloomers → Little Plum's Bloomers
Description: Found in a trash can at People Park. Distinctive bloomers, to say the least. Found in a trash can at People Park. Stolen by Wesley Stickler.

[10] Name: Knife
Description: Also known as a "shiv". Found at the crime scene bearing Wocky's prints.

[11] Name: Meraktis's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: June 14, after 10 PM. Cause of death: Single bullet to the right temple.

[12] Name: Noodle Stand
Description: Mr. Eldoon's noodle stand. Victim died pulling it.

[13] Name: Wocky's Check-Up Report
Description: Results from a check-up performed in June. Metallic object found near heart.

[14] Name: Pistol
Description: Weapon left at the crime scene. Two rounds were fired. Fingerprints were wiped.

[15] Name: Detective Skye's Orders
Description: "Allow clinic access to this magician and attorney, in Prosecutor Gavin's name."

[16] Name: Sandals → Alita's Sandals
Description: Cute women's sandals. Found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Women's sandals found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Big toe print found on left sandal.

[17] Name: Lamp
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic office with a broken bulb and a red stain on the cord.

[18] Name: Wocky's Chart
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe.  Signed by nurse Alita Tiala.

[19] Name: Bullet
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe. Squished from impact with the back of the safe.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I did go to the clinic that day. My first time in half a year, since I quit in January.
[1] Testimony: I went to warn him. After all, I knew Wocky had the pistol.
[2] Testimony: The doctor always was a timid man... too timid to admit his own mistake.
[3] Testimony: Why else would I have gone? I'm not hiding any dark secrets.
[4] Testimony: Why would I go to the clinic now for a half-year-old chart?
[5] Testimony: I wanted to tell him to be careful, as an old friend.
[6] Testimony: Nothing happened at all. I warned him, and left.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Alita was a nurse that used to work with the victim who was a doctor. She is describing here whereabouts on the day the a shooting happened in the victim's clinic.

[0] Name: Armband

Description: A street map of the local area showing where the victim was found. A street map of the local area showing locations that are relevant to the case.

[2] Name: Iris's Postcard
Description: A card for Inspector Gregson with a message on the back from Iris.

[3] Name: Secondhand Book Receipt
Description: A receipt discovered in Mr Natsume's room for some books that he had purchased from a secondhand bookshop before the incident occurred. The receipt comes from the shop 'Yore Books', and there are three books on the receipt.

[4] Name: Case File
Description: A file containing an overview of the case and details about the victim. She was found with a knife in her back and is currently in hospital, yet to regain consciousness. The pavement where the victim was found lies just outside Constable Beate's beat, the border of which runs down the middle of Briar Road.

[5] Name: Jackknife
Description: A large but commonplace folding knife. It was found lodged in the victim's back.

[6] Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident occurred. A large knife can be seen thrust into the victim's back.

[7] Name: Crime Scene Photograph #2
Description: A second photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident. It specifically shows the victim's hand.

[8] Name: The Fourth Book
Description: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene. A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene. The back cover is badly burnt. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining the burnt corner on the back before it is specifically pointed out in court.)

[9] Name: Warrant Card
Description: A small folding wallet that identifies London bobbies and contains the rules of conduct to which they must adhere.

[10] Name: Anniversary Bouquet
Description: A present for Patricia Beate from her husband, Roly. The shock of seeing the stabbed victim caused Mrs Beate to drop the rose where she stood.

[11] Name: Pipe
Description: Mr Garrideb's pipe. Apparently it fell to the floor during a domestic dispute he had with his wife and broke.

[12] Name: Fragment of Metal
Description: This small piece of metal looks like it might be the tip of a knife blade. It was stuck inside the bowl of Mr Garrideb's pipe. This fragment of metal aligned perfectly with the end of the jackknife, which had been chipped.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: As I said, it was five o'clock in the afternoon when the incident occurred. And there was an unusually light fog.
[1] Testimony: Visibility was reasonably good, and there was no one else about but the victim and the accused.
[2] Testimony: Out of the blue, the victim was stabbed from behind and subsequently collapsed on the pavement.
[3] Testimony: The accused ran off, scatterin' his belongings all over the floor.
[4] Testimony: Those bein' a number of old books he'd just bought. He was on his way home from a bookshop, it seems.
[5] Testimony: He was on his way home from Bourbon Books, a secondhand bookshop he apparently patronises.
[6] Testimony: It was just a matter of workin' out who the books belonged to, and we found the bloke to arrest him.

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: It was our wedding anniversary, and Roly was taking me out for a meal. There was no time to change after work.
[1] Testimony: Anyway, two silhouettes appeared out of the fog on the pavement in front of us.
[2] Testimony: All of a sudden, one of them just collapsed on the floor. Then the other scattered something before running off!
[3] Testimony: We ran straight over of course, and then went for help at a nearby police box.
[4] Testimony: It was definitely that Japanese man in the dock. Roly and I both saw him as clear as day!
[5] Testimony: I could even tell you the names of the four books he dropped at the scene.

[0] Testimony: It was our wedding anniversary, and Roly was taking me out for a meal. There was no time to change after work.

[0] Testimony: This case has nothing to do with Mr and Mrs Garrideb. Believe me, a London bobby is good for his word!
[1] Testimony: You see - SAH! - the windows on the top floor of the Garrideb house are top-hinged casements.
[2] Testimony: Obviously, if anything had been thrown out of the window, we would have seen it.
[3] Testimony: I did leave the scene to go and fetch help, but my trusty Roly was there to make sure nothing was disturbed.
[4] Testimony: I know what I saw. My eyes never let me down! ...My sense of direction is a little off sometimes, though.
[5] Testimony: What happened was, I dropped my bouquet and ended up losing my way for a while.
[6] Testimony: I didn't take my eye off the crime scene for one moment, sah! Nothing strange to report on that front, sah!

[0] Testimony: Yes, on the day you're referring to, the wife and I did have a bit of a skirmish. Can't recall the reason now.
[1] Testimony: Knocked a candlestick over and set fire to the carpet! Soon had it out, though, and got the window open.
[2] Testimony: Meanwhile...I was picking up whatever I could find to throw at him.
[3] Testimony: Plenty of knives around our place. Can't say I'd notice if one or two went missing, I'm afraid.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Trés Bien.

[2] Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.

[3] Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Trés Bien on Dec. 3rd. Click here for details.

[4] Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.

[5] Name: Lunch Special
Description: Trés Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.

[6] Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen.

[7] Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.

[8] Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.

[9] Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"

[10] Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.

[11] Name: Trés Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. Click here for details. X = victim's seat.

[12] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.

[13] Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints. Facing the cup, one can see a lip stain on the front, and a floral looking handle to the right.

[14] Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.

[15] Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.

[16] Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.

[17] Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Trés Bien. The bag is empty.

[18] Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

[19] Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!

[20] Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".

[21] Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!

[22] Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.

[23] Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program.

[24] Name: Trés Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.

[25] Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.

[26] Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.

[27] Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The crime was reported at 2:25 PM by a kind of scary old man, sir.
[1] Testimony: Poor Maggey had passed out from the shock. It must've been real tough for her.
[2] Testimony: The victim didn't have any identification on him.
[3] Testimony: But we figured out who he was pretty quick, and then the investigation went smoothly.
[4] Testimony: When Maggey was searched, we found the lottery ticket and the bottle of poison.
[5] Testimony: And that was it. There was nothing else missing from the crime scene.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
Detective Gunshoe is describing what the police found at the crime scene.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. The first and last time I used it was a year ago.

[1] Name: Doug's Autopsy Report
Description: Date and time of death: 4/9 at 3 PM. Cause of death was a fatal electric shock.

[2] Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The crime took place behind an Ivy U. building. [caption] The victim is lying head down. He is wearing a plain shirt. There is a broken power cable with sparks hanging above him. An umbrella with a bent handle lies open in a distance.

[3] Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: The victim's watch stopped at the time of death. [caption] The victim's hand is holding a bottle a medicine labeled as coldkiller. The victim's watch stopped at the time of death at 3:05.

[4] Name: Coldkiller X
Description: Found clutched in the victim's hand. Covered in Wright's fingerprints.

[5] Name: Umbrella
Description: Owned by the victim. Found broken near an electrical pole at the crime scene.

[6] Name: Phoenix's Testimony
Description: The victim fell on top of his umbrella. There was a loud sound when this happened.

[7] Name: Dahlia's Present
Description: A small bottle necklace given to Wright on the day they met. He shows it to everyone.

[8] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article from 8/28, almost 8 months ago. Click here for details.

[9] Name: Student's Testimony
Description: The old power cable broke due to some sort of impact on 4/9 at 2:55 PM.

[10] Name: Police Report
Description: A report on the incident eight months ago. [info] 
*Incident Overview

Location: District Courthouse
Date/Time: August 27, 4:00 PM
