input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Secondhand Book Receipt
Description: A receipt for some books that Mr Natsume purchased at a secondhand bookshop. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

[2] Name: Nearby Street Map
Description: A street map of the neighbourhood where Mr Natsume has his lodgings. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

[3] Name: Pair of Teacups
Description: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. The one with the green line around the rim was Mr Natsume's. The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. There is no tea ring on the inside of Mr Natsume's cup.

[4] Name: Torn-Off End of Envelope
Description: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. The rest of the envelope could not be located. A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It fits perfectly with an envelope in Miss Green's possession.

[5] Name: Bar of Soap
Description: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. It's one of two that were found there. A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. There is a two centimetre diameter circular depression in the middle of one surface.

[6] Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the scene taken by police upon their arrival. The victim can be seen unconscious at the table, having been poisoned.

[7] Name: Victim's Medical Report
Description: A report issued by Scotland Yard's medical officer. It obviously mentions the poison as well as other details gleaned during the police investigation.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I'm proud to be the company's East End branch investigator and meter money collection agent.
[1] Testimony: Altamont gas meters accept thruppenny bits, each coin givin' customers about two hours of gorgeous gas!
[2] Testimony: And yet, the meter in Mr Shamspeare's room didn't have a single coin in it!
[3] Testimony: The meter doesn't appear to have been tampered with, though, and the collection agent has the only key.
[4] Testimony: All joints on the meter are welded shut, and the lock is made from solid steel. There's no way to dismantle it.
[5] Testimony: The meter is designed for coins the exact diameter and thickness of a thruppenny bit. Nothing else will fit.
[6] Testimony: Somehow, he's usin' all the flamin' gas he wants without payin' a penny! If that's not thievin', what is?!

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.

[1] Name: Arrow
Description: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.

[2] Name: Courte's Planner
Description: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page. [info] She recorded all of her plans in great detail. One page reads, "23rd - Meet with Hugh" and "Important."

[3] Name: Themis Herald
Description: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.

[4] Name: Stage Costume
Description: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)

[5] Name: Mock Trial Script
Description: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)

[6] Name: Themis Herald Extra
Description: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.

[7] Name: Awl
Description: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Courte's Autopsy Report
Description: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.

[9] Name: Tape Recorder
Description: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd.

[10] Name: Glowing Costume Photo
Description: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.

[11] Name: School Camera Photo
Description: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.

[12] Name: School Banner
Description: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.

[13] Name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
Description: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places. Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more.

[14] Name: White Fragment → White Fragments
Description: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular. Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.

[15] Name: Lady Justice
Description: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from. It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.

[16] Name: "Hugh" Scrap
Description: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.

[17] Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.

[18] Name: Stage Set Up Photos
Description: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)

[19] Name: Voiceprint Analysis
Description: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.

[20] Name: Lecture Hall Diagram
Description: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I snuck into Juniper's dressing room while everyone was in the Lecture Hall.
[1] Testimony: Juniper had changed into her stage costume. I asked her, "What're you doing?"
[2] Testimony: When suddenly, she fled into the hallway, as if she wanted me to follow her.
[3] Testimony: I followed her all the way to Prof. Courte's body! She led me right to it!
[4] Testimony: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made! [caption] The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Scuttlebutt describes the clothing that the defendant Juniper was wearing when the body was discovered.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: To get mentally prepared for the mock trial, I meditated at the archery range till 7:00 PM.
[1] Testimony: At around 7:15, I went to the main building before going home. That's when I saw Juniper.
[2] Testimony: We didn't say much as we passed by each other. She seemed her usual self.
[3] Testimony: Oh, let me add I never went to the art room. There was no reason for me to be there.
[4] Testimony: The final bell had rung ten, fifteen minutes earlier. No biggie.
[5] Testimony: I didn't talk to anyone until the final bell. I'd been meditating alone at the archery range.
[6] Testimony: That's it. Anything else you'd like to ask?

input.full_input:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.

[1] Name: Arrow
Description: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.

[2] Name: Courte's Planner
Description: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page. [info] She recorded all of her plans in great detail. One page reads, "23rd - Meet with Hugh" and "Important."

[3] Name: Themis Herald
Description: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.

[4] Name: Stage Costume
Description: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)

[5] Name: Mock Trial Script
Description: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)

[6] Name: Themis Herald Extra
Description: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.

[7] Name: Awl
Description: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Courte's Autopsy Report
Description: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.

[9] Name: Tape Recorder
Description: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd.

[10] Name: Glowing Costume Photo
Description: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.

[11] Name: School Camera Photo
Description: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.

[12] Name: School Banner
Description: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.

[13] Name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
Description: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places. Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more.

[14] Name: White Fragment → White Fragments
Description: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular. Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.

[15] Name: Lady Justice
Description: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from. It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.

[16] Name: "Hugh" Scrap
Description: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.

[17] Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.

[18] Name: Stage Set Up Photos
Description: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)

[19] Name: Voiceprint Analysis
Description: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.

[20] Name: Lecture Hall Diagram
Description: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: To get mentally prepared for the mock trial, I meditated at the archery range till 7:00 PM.
[1] Testimony: At around 7:15, I went to the main building before going home. That's when I saw Juniper.
[2] Testimony: We didn't say much as we passed by each other. She seemed her usual self.
[3] Testimony: Oh, let me add I never went to the art room. There was no reason for me to be there.
[4] Testimony: The final bell had rung ten, fifteen minutes earlier. No biggie.
[5] Testimony: I didn't talk to anyone until the final bell. I'd been meditating alone at the archery range.
[6] Testimony: That's it. Anything else you'd like to ask?

Summarized context:
The witness O'Connor describes his whereabouts on the day of the murder.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

[1] Name: Magic Show Ticket
Description: For premier showing of a grand illusion, to be performed by the magician, Valant Gramarye.

[2] Name: Gramarye Envelope
Description: Envelope from Mr. Wright. Do not open until the time is right.

[3] Name: Vera's Card
Description: Defendant's business card. The address for Drew Studio is on the front.

[4] Name: Portrait
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. That bit in the middle is supposed to be a person.

[5] Name: Acrylic
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. An undersea scene in vivid colors.

[6] Name: Landscape
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. Only half finished, the rough sketch is still visible.

[7] Name: Coffee Mug
Description: The victim's last mug of coffee. The scrawl on the side is Drew Misham's signature. Traces of the slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine were found on the rim.

[8] Name: Hidden Painting
Description: Found at Drew Studio. Notable for the large peach in the foreground.

[9] Name: Red Envelope
Description: Found in the victim's desk drawer. Appears to have been opened once and resealed. Found in the victim's desk drawer. Contains two sheets of writing paper.

[10] Name: Letter Box
Description: Drew Misham's contact with the outside world. It's empty.

[11] Name: Tiny Frame
Description: Frame measuring two inches by two inches. Bears traces of deadly poison atroquinine.

[12] Name: Brushel's Card
Description: This business card reads "Spark Brushel, Freelance Journalist".

[13] Name: Misham's Autopsy Report
Description: Death by atroquinine poisoning. Estimated time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.

[14] Name: Crime Photo
Description: Body found in hospital room, shot in the forehead. Click here for details.

[15] Name: Magnifi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: single gunshot to the head. Estimated time of death: 11:00-11:30 PM.

[16] Name: Notebook Page
Description: Mysterious paper received just before the trial. Click here for details. Forged to look like a page of Magnifi's diary. Click here for details.

[17] Name: Magnifi's Chart
Description: Diagnosed with a malignant tumor. Given 3 months. Click here for details.

[18] Name: Small Syringe
Description: Used for administering insulin shots. Has been washed and shows no sign of use.

[19] Name: Magnifi's Letter
Description: Letter asking Zak to shoot him. Click here for details.

[20] Name: Stage Pistol
Description: Fires one real bullet. Rifling marks match bullet found in victim. No fingerprints found.

[21] Name: Magnifi's Letter 2
Description: Letter telling Valant to come at 11:20 PM. Click here for details.

[22] Name: IV Report
Description: IV stopped 10 min. after administration began. Click here for details.

[23] Name: Magnifi's Diary
Description: A memoir of sorts. Written in up to just before he died.

[24] Name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
Description: Trucy's favorite trick. Startlingly realistic.

[25] Name: Trucy's Locket
Description: Contains a photo of Trucy's mother, Thalassa.

[26] Name: Transferal of Rights
Description: Document tranferring the right to perform the Gramarye repertoire to daughter Trucy.

[27] Name: Nail Polish
Description: Retrieved from Kristoph Gavin's cell. The nail polish is colorless.

[28] Name: Commemorative Stamp
Description: Commemorative stamp showing Troupe Gramarye. Click here for details. Sent from the real "client". Click here for details.

[29] Name: Thalassa's Portrait
Description: Photo of a young Thalassa, Trucy's mother. Click here for details.

[30] Name: Zak's Confession
Description: Confession to the slaying of Magnifi Gramarye. Click here for details.

[31] Name: Letter from Misham
Description: Letter posted by Drew Misham just before dying. Poison traces found on the stamp.

[32] Name: Letter from Mr. Wright
Description: Reproduction of information found by Mr. Wright during his investigation.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Actually... the victim kind of ordered the defendant to do him in.
[1] Testimony: A few days before it happened, the victim sent a letter "ordering" his own murder.
[2] Testimony: The defendant did what was asked of him, and shot the old man in the forehead!
[3] Testimony: The bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene, no doubt about it.
[4] Testimony: And the pistol definitely belonged to the old man, sir!
[5] Testimony: So what if he shot the clown? He still shot the victim, pal!

The witness Detective Gumshoe is arguing who the gun found at the crime scene belonged to.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Ellen's Pendant
Description: A pendant worn by Ellen. It seems she received it from her fiancé.

[2] Name: Ellen's Statement
Description: Ellen saw a suspicious third party on the vista deck when she was being attacked by Gloomsbury.

[3] Name: Flying Chapel Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for the Flying Chapel. It includes a brief introduction and diagrams of its layout. [info] It shows a Pegacow and a Pegabull in their example diagram of the reception hall.

[4] Name: Time Keeper
Description: The murder weapon. Dubbed the "Time Keeper," it's a clock with a secret mechanism. The activated Time Keeper. It's obvious that it was in this state when it was used on the victim.

[5] Name: Broken Lantern
Description: The Pegabull lantern in which the victim's body was found. The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began.

[6] Name: Photo of Victim
Description: The victim was discovered inside of the lanterns in the reception hall. [caption] The victim lies face up in the broken lantern. There are some red petals on top of him. There is blood on his left hand. There is a piece of paper near his right hand. A light bulb lies close to him.

[7] Name: Gloomsbury's Note
Description: A note found near the victim's body. The writing is smudged as through written by a right-handed person.

[8] Name: Fog Machine
Description: A device that utilizes dry ice to emit a large amount of thick, fog-like vapor.

[9] Name: Business Card Wallet
Description: A business card holder with a peculiar yet suspiciously familiar imprint in the center.

[10] Name: Photo of Reception
Description: A photo of the reception taken by a relative. Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.

[11] Name: Selena Sprocket Photo
Description: A photo of Sorin's older sister, Selena. It looks like it was taken in some kind of office.

[12] Name: Larry's Drawing
Description: A drawing Larry made from inside a cabin. It shows a pterodactyl flying outside the window. A drawing Larry made. He probably mistook something for what he claims is a pterodactyl in this picture.

[13] Name: Photo of Hold
Description: A photo of the hold, stealthily taken by Larry. Ellen can be seen near the center.

[14] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Gloomsbury's head shows signs of being hit twice. The Time Keeper was used as the murder weapon.

[15] Name: Hold Entry Record
Description: A record of the key cards used to access the airship hold.

[16] Name: Lift Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift in the hold. It's unknown whose blood it is. A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift. It matches the blood on the candelabra.

[17] Name: Candelabra
Description: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's left hand, which is his dominant hand. A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Traces of blood were found on it.

[18] Name: Sorin's Notebook
Description: A database-like notebook that chronicles the events of each day in minute detail. A notebook that records Sorin's memories in minute detail. One of the pages has been torn out.

[19] Name: Newspaper Article
Description: A clipping of a newspaper article detailing the car accident that resulted in Selena Sprocket's death. A clipping of a newspaper article about Selena Sprocket's car accident. Sorin was the one driving.

[20] Name: Key of Love
Description: A heart-shaped key used to activate the Time Keeper.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The murder weapon was a clock called the "Time Keeper."
[1] Testimony: The victim was hit with it from behind, and he fell over, right into the lantern.
[2] Testimony: The defendant was spotted then, standing in front of the body holding the murder weapon.
[3] Testimony: The victim was struck twice, by the way.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.

[2] Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. Click here for details.

[3] Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime.

[4] Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value.

[5] Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. [info] 

To the Security at Lordly Tailor.

I will be coming to purloin the most
priceless work of art on display in
your "Treasures of Kurain" exhibit.

Take good care of the speckled urn, won't you...?

Yours truly,
Mask DeMasque

[6] Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.

[7] Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.

[8] Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.

[9] Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.

[10] Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. [info] 

Blackmail Letter

If you don't want your true
identity revealed to the world,
come to KB security at 1:00 AM
on October 12th and bring
$50,000.

If you don't, I'll take that red diamond you received the other day instead. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.

[11] Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).

[12] Name: Key Card → CEO Office Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used.

[13] Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.

[14] Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.

[15] Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.

[16] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.

[17] Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.

[18] Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.

[19] Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.

[20] Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.

[21] Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.

[22] Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago.
[1] Testimony: The urn was placed in a box, and Zvarri! It was then sent to the warehouse.
[2] Testimony: Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime...
[3] Testimony: I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand.
[4] Testimony: I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!
[5] Testimony: At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.

The witness Atmey claims that Mask DeMasque saw the urn which was the item stolen for the first time on the day of the crime. We know that Mask DeMasque always sends out a calling card before a heist. We also know that the urn had a speckled pattern, which was added by paint before the crime.

Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used.

[13] Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.

[14] Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.

[15] Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.

[16] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.

[17] Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.

[18] Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.

[19] Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.

[20] Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.

[21] Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.

[22] Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I, Luke Atmey, had no points of contact with the victim whatsoever.
[1] Testimony: Kane Bullard decided to investigate Mask DeMasque and simply mistook who he was!
[2] Testimony: It was Mr. Bullard who wrote the blackmail letter and sent it to Ron DeLite.
[3] Testimony: And it was again Mr. Bullard who harbored a grudge against Mr. DeLite for his betrayal!
[4] Testimony: Mr. Bullard's mistake is quite excusable. The defendant truly believes he is Mask DeMasque.
[5] Testimony: That is why Mr. DeLite saw it fit to kill Kane Bullard. Truly a tragedy...

Summarized context:
The witness Atmey asserts that the victim Kane Bullard was killed by Mask DeMasque due to a grudge and a betrayal.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
[1] Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
[2] Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
[3] Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
[4] Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
[5] Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: After Mystic Elise died... I called out to Mystic Maya.
[1] Testimony: I thought it was my duty to protect the future Master of the Kurain Tradition.
[2] Testimony: So I removed the body from the Inner Temple by myself...
[3] Testimony: I dragged it behind me all the way across Dusky Bridge.
[4] Testimony: Then I used the snowmobile to carry it back to Hazakura Temple and...
[5] Testimony: ...I used the Shichishito to alter the way the wound looked.
[6] Testimony: By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped.

[0] Testimony: I was passing through the garden on the way to a spare prep room when it happened.
[1] Testimony: Suddenly, someone struck me over the head...
[2] Testimony: I stumbled... and ended up against the stone lantern.

[5] Testimony: Then something warm splashed over me...
[6] Testimony: That's when... I lost consciousness.

[0] Testimony: ...When I came to, I was just lying there on the Training Hall floor.
[1] Testimony: By the time I got back to the garden, the place had totally changed...

[5] Testimony: Since the person did all that work alone, I just assumed it was a man...

Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.

[11] Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.

[12] Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.

[13] Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.

[14] Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.

[15] Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 

[16] Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.

[17] Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.

[18] Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.

[19] Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.

[20] Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.

[21] Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Pearly was also stuck on the Inner Temple side that night!
[1] Testimony: The next morning, she looked around, but couldn't find anyone.
[2] Testimony: The next day, when the bridge was finally fixed, she was in the spare prep room.
[3] Testimony: That's when Mr. Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time!
[4] Testimony: He found Pearly first, and cheered her right up!

Summarized context:
The witness Maya is testifying about Pearl Fey and Godot's movement the morning after the night of the crime.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.

[2] Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.

[3] Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.

[4] Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

[5] Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.

[6] Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.

[7] Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.

[8] Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.

[9] Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.

[10] Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.

[11] Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. [caption] Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.

[12] Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.

[13] Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.

[14] Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.

[15] Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.

[16] Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.

[17] Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.

[18] Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

[19] Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.

[20] Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.

[21] Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.

[22] Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.

[23] Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.

[24] Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.

[25] Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.

[26] Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.

[27] Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
[1] Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
[2] Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
[3] Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
[4] Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Ihmus describes how he witnessed the crime.

Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.

[0] Testimony: That evening, I was enjoying a trek through the night sky with my homemade paraglider.
[1] Testimony: But just as Mt. Poniponi was drawing near, something terrible happened!
[2] Testimony: An accident forced me to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum!
[3] Testimony: Gale force winds came out of nowhere, so I made an emergency landing at the sanctum!
[4] Testimony: As I landed, I banged my head, causing me to lose my memory!
[5] Testimony: So you see, I ended up at the Inner Sanctum purely by accident!

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Smith's Autopsy Report
Description: The time of death was around 2 AM, April 17. Death caused by a single blow to the forehead.

[2] Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The sub-basement at the Borscht Bowl Club. [caption] A man is found dead, slumped in a chair and leaning back. He is wearing a hat which covers his eyes and forehead. The table is set for a game of poker. Cards and chipped scartter around the table. There are some cards lying on the floor too. A bottle of grape juice is on the table. The room is dimly lit, with light coming in from a small window. The walls are partially peeled.

[3] Name: Deadly Bottle
Description: Grape juice bottle used as the murder weapon. Bears the defendant Mr. Wright's prints. [caption] The bottle is empty. Grape juice bottle used as the murder weapon. Mr. Wright's prints on it are upside-down.

[4] Name: Wright's Cell Phone
Description: Used by the defendant to notify the police from the restaurant's first floor.

[5] Name: Olga's Photo
Description: The defendant & Mr. Smith at the Borscht Bowl Club. Click here for details.

[6] Name: Chip Photo
Description: Defendant & victim's chips when crime took place. [caption] On the near side, there are 4 red, small chips and 1 gray, big chip. On the far side, there are 2 red, small chips and 9 gray, big chips. On the near side, the cards are 7 heart, 7 diamond, 7 club, Ace spade, and Ace diamond. On the far side, the cards are King heart, King diamond, King spade, Ace club, and Ace heart.

[7] Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: Photo of forehead. Hat removed during investigation. Click here for details.

[8] Name: Wright's Hand * (Wright's hand and Victim's hand are in fact two different pieces of evidence, with Wright's hand being entirely optional. )
Description: Defendant Wright's hand. Was left at the scene. A full house.

[9] Name: Victim's Hand
Description: Victim Smith's hand. Was left at the scene. A full house.

[10] Name: Bloody Ace
Description: Received from a mysterious girl. Could this be the missing "fifth ace"?
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I am a pianist by trade... yet I can hardly play at all.
[1] Testimony: My real job is to take on interested customers over at the poker table.
[2] Testimony: The room where we play and the competition in there are the club's main attractions.
[3] Testimony: The rules are simple: we play a game of poker using two decks of cards.
[4] Testimony: That's all it is... a game. And our customers are happy.
[5] Testimony: I plead silence regarding the murder. But I will say I never touched the murder weapon.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Smith's Autopsy Report
Description: The time of death was around 2 AM, April 17. Death caused by a single blow to the forehead.

[2] Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The sub-basement at the Borscht Bowl Club. [caption] A man is found dead, slumped in a chair and leaning back. He is wearing a hat which covers his eyes and forehead. The table is set for a game of poker. Cards and chipped scartter around the table. There are some cards lying on the floor too. A bottle of grape juice is on the table. The room is dimly lit, with light coming in from a small window. The walls are partially peeled.

[3] Name: Deadly Bottle
Description: Grape juice bottle used as the murder weapon. Bears the defendant Mr. Wright's prints. [caption] The bottle is empty. Grape juice bottle used as the murder weapon. Mr. Wright's prints on it are upside-down.

[4] Name: Wright's Cell Phone
Description: Used by the defendant to notify the police from the restaurant's first floor.

[5] Name: Olga's Photo
Description: The defendant & Mr. Smith at the Borscht Bowl Club. Click here for details.

[6] Name: Chip Photo
Description: Defendant & victim's chips when crime took place. [caption] On the near side, there are 4 red, small chips and 1 gray, big chip. On the far side, there are 2 red, small chips and 9 gray, big chips. On the near side, the cards are 7 heart, 7 diamond, 7 club, Ace spade, and Ace diamond. On the far side, the cards are King heart, King diamond, King spade, Ace club, and Ace heart.

[7] Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: Photo of forehead. Hat removed during investigation. Click here for details.

[8] Name: Wright's Hand * (Wright's hand and Victim's hand are in fact two different pieces of evidence, with Wright's hand being entirely optional. )
Description: Defendant Wright's hand. Was left at the scene. A full house.

[9] Name: Victim's Hand
Description: Victim Smith's hand. Was left at the scene. A full house.

[10] Name: Bloody Ace
Description: Received from a mysterious girl. Could this be the missing "fifth ace"?

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)

[1] Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)

[2] Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.

[3] Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.

[4] Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.

[5] Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.

[6] Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.

[7] Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

[0] Testimony: I went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM...

[6] Testimony: I thought I'd never get another chance to see something so big burning!

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Steal the Founder's Orb? Me?! I did it?! This lying lawyer's insults know no limit!
[1] Testimony: The real method to open the lock, you say?! Delusional, man! There ain't no other way!
[2] Testimony: All this time, I guarded the orb faithfully. Sacred duty to the Holy Mother, easy to see.
[3] Testimony: Hands unclean, the accused did the deed. Forced the box open. No key did he need.
[4] Testimony: Khura'inese butterfly from the 7th century, Carries the mitamah -- so elementary.
[5] Testimony: Only the Mitamah Key unlocks the treasure. Force it, and reap the founder's displeasure!
[6] Testimony: Lying lawyer! Condemn him to hell! Kick him, throw him, into a prison cell!

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Ellen's Pendant
Description: A pendant worn by Ellen. It seems she received it from her fiancé.

[2] Name: Ellen's Statement
Description: Ellen saw a suspicious third party on the vista deck when she was being attacked by Gloomsbury.

[3] Name: Flying Chapel Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for the Flying Chapel. It includes a brief introduction and diagrams of its layout.

[4] Name: Time Keeper
Description: The murder weapon. Dubbed the "Time Keeper," it's a clock with a secret mechanism. The activated Time Keeper. It's obvious that it was in this state when it was used on the victim.

[5] Name: Broken Lantern
Description: The Pegabull lantern in which the victim's body was found. The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began.

[6] Name: Photo of Victim
Description: The victim was discovered inside of the lanterns in the reception hall.

[7] Name: Gloomsbury's Note
Description: A note found near the victim's body. The writing is smudged as through written by a right-handed person.

[8] Name: Fog Machine
Description: A device that utilizes dry ice to emit a large amount of thick, fog-like vapor.

[9] Name: Business Card Wallet
Description: A business card holder with a peculiar yet suspiciously familiar imprint in the center.

[10] Name: Photo of Reception
Description: A photo of the reception taken by a relative. Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.

[11] Name: Selena Sprocket Photo
Description: A photo of Sorin's older sister, Selena. It looks like it was taken in some kind of office.

[12] Name: Larry's Drawing
Description: A drawing Larry made from inside a cabin. It shows a pterodactyl flying outside the window. A drawing Larry made. He probably mistook something for what he claims is a pterodactyl in this picture.

[13] Name: Photo of Hold
Description: A photo of the hold, stealthily taken by Larry. Ellen can be seen near the center.

[14] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Gloomsbury's head shows signs of being hit twice. The Time Keeper was used as the murder weapon.

[15] Name: Hold Entry Record
Description: A record of the key cards used to access the airship hold.

[16] Name: Lift Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift in the hold. It's unknown whose blood it is. A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift. It matches the blood on the candelabra.

[17] Name: Candelabra
Description: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's left hand, which is his dominant hand. A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Traces of blood were found on it.

[18] Name: Sorin's Notebook
Description: A database-like notebook that chronicles the events of each day in minute detail. A notebook that records Sorin's memories in minute detail. One of the pages has been torn out.

[19] Name: Newspaper Article
Description: A clipping of a newspaper article detailing the car accident that resulted in Selena Sprocket's death. A clipping of a newspaper article about Selena Sprocket's car accident. Sorin was the one driving.

[20] Name: Key of Love
Description: A heart-shaped key used to activate the Time Keeper.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.

[1] Name: Arrow
Description: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.

[2] Name: Courte's Planner
Description: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page.

[3] Name: Themis Herald
Description: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.

[4] Name: Stage Costume
Description: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)

[5] Name: Mock Trial Script
Description: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)

[6] Name: Themis Herald Extra
Description: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.

[7] Name: Awl
Description: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Courte's Autopsy Report
Description: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.

[9] Name: Tape Recorder
Description: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd.

[10] Name: Glowing Costume Photo
Description: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.

[11] Name: School Camera Photo
Description: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.

[12] Name: School Banner
Description: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.

[13] Name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
Description: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places. Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more.

[14] Name: White Fragment → White Fragments
Description: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular. Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.

[15] Name: Lady Justice
Description: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from. It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.

[16] Name: "Hugh" Scrap
Description: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.

[17] Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.

[18] Name: Stage Set Up Photos
Description: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.) [caption] There is a tall construction screen between the stage and the vantange point near the maintenance area. Two banners are lying on the stage. A person is watching the stage. Another person is making a sculpture on the stage.

[19] Name: Voiceprint Analysis
Description: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.

[20] Name: Lecture Hall Diagram
Description: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The Lecture Hall was packed before the mock trial, but the rest of the campus was empty.
[1] Testimony: That's when I saw Juniper dragging a large mat from behind the stage.
[2] Testimony: I was watching her from a vantage point between the stage and the maintenance area.
[3] Testimony: She was heading towards me, so I assume she was on her way to the maintenance area.
[4] Testimony: But I didn't have time to stand around and see what she did after that.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness O'Connor describes the defendant Juniper's whereabouts around the time of the murder.

[2] Name: Statue

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.
[1] Testimony: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.
[2] Testimony: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.
[3] Testimony: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!
[4] Testimony: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.
[5] Testimony: I thought to call the police immediately!
[6] Testimony: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.
[7] Testimony: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.
[8] Testimony: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00 PM.
[9] Testimony: The man who ran was, without a doubt, the defendant sitting right over there.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

[1] Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within.

[2] Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.

[3] Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee. [caption] The victim is lying in the study next to floor-to-ceiling windows with clear glass. He is covered by books.

[4] Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area. [caption] There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window. On the other side of the window is the bookshelf.

[5] Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.

[6] Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."

[7] Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.

[8] Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.

[9] Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb. Found on the computer in Archie Buff's study, it was sent from Buff to "PAW-711@nmail" as a reply to an earlier email concerning his research into the Founder's Orb.

[10] Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.

[11] Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.

[12] Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.

[13] Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.

[14] Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.

[15] Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.

[16] Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.

[17] Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.

[18] Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.

[19] Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.

[20] Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.

[21] Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.

[22] Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.

[23] Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago.

[24] Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.

[25] Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, and stole Nayna's hat.

[26] Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.

[27] Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.

[28] Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.

[29] Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The police have had their eye on Dr. Buff for some time.
[1] Testimony: And just today, a number of stolen artifacts were discovered in his study.
[2] Testimony: Among them were a priceless urn and a statue that were stolen from the Fey clan.
[3] Testimony: It seems the doctor would do anything to study artifacts, including steal them.
[4] Testimony: As for the relic at the center of this dispute, he likely stole it from the Atishon residence.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Papa met with someone the night he died.
[1] Testimony: I didn't have eyes on the ground, as I'd already mounted my siege defense, but...
[2] Testimony: ...I did hear him arguing with someone in his study!
[3] Testimony: From my window, I saw the one designated "Datz" getting ejected from the premises.
[4] Testimony: After that, the man lingered around the perimeter for some time.
[5] Testimony: He must have regrouped and killed my papa in the study later -- I just know it!

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: It was around 11 at night, and I was out on a mobile meet-and-greet around the village.
[1] Testimony: That's when I saw Dr. Buff being murdered from outside his study window!
[2] Testimony: Mr. Are'bal snuck up from behind and struck him on the head.
[3] Testimony: The doctor was standing in front of the bookshelves, absorbed in a book.
[4] Testimony: His weapon of choice: a suitcase.
[5] Testimony: A big, strong man like him could easily swing a heavy suitcase into someone's head.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.

[2] Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.

[3] Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.

[4] Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

[5] Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.

[6] Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.

[7] Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.

[8] Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.

[9] Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.

[10] Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.

[11] Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.

[12] Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.

[13] Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.

[14] Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.

[15] Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.

[16] Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.

[17] Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.

[18] Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

[19] Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.

[20] Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.

[21] Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.

[22] Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.

[23] Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.

[24] Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.

[25] Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.

[26] Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.

[27] Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
[1] Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
[2] Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
[3] Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
[4] Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Ema presents the victim's information. We know that all members of the Khura'inist clergy must have been born in the country, and all bear outstanding tattoos, that no one else bears.

[17] Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report

[18] Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

[19] Name: Brand New Flag

[20] Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.

[21] Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.

[22] Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.

[23] Name: Tome of Secrets

[25] Name: Golden Orb

[27] Name: Warbaa'd Statue

[0] Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
[1] Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
[2] Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
[3] Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
[4] Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.

The witness Ema presents the victim's information. We know that all members of the Khura'inist clergy must have been born in the country, and all bear outstanding tattoos, that no one else bears.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

[2] Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

[3] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

[4] Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

[5] Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

[6] Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

[7] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

[8] Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

[9] Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

[10] Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

[11] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

[12] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

[13] Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

[14] Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

[15] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head.

[16] Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

[17] Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

[18] Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium. [caption] Jigoku carries a large trunk with him.

[19] Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

[20] Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

[21] Name: Passport

[0] Name: Armband

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I had a guest waiting for me when I returned to my cabin after finishing my evening meal in the dining room.
[1] Testimony: When I walked through the door, a mustachioed Englishman was there, foolishly waving a gun at me.
[2] Testimony: I soon took care of him with an ippon seoi throw, though. He couldn't wait to run away after that.
[3] Testimony: I imagine his watch was broken when I threw him over my shoulder. It has nothing to do with his murder.
[4] Testimony: The inspector was clearly killed having returned to Britain. Because his body was found in London.
[5] Testimony: There's no possible way I could have transported the victim's corpse back to Britain.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: As the warder responsible for condemned convicts, I attended to Mr Asogi and kept watch over his cell.
[1] Testimony: The night after he was found guilty in court, he was doing something with that will in his cell!
[2] Testimony: We turned the cell inside out looking for it after the execution, but to no avail.
[3] Testimony: I only found oot about the Asogi Papers when a directive came tellin' me to impound them.
[4] Testimony: The document was in the folds of the fella's robe that was left in his cell. A 'kimono', I think it's called.
[5] Testimony: As I remember it, the document was written in scarlet ink, but...perhaps I'm mistaken.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin.

[2] Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)

[3] Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor.

[4] Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.

[5] Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)

[6] Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!

[7] Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.

[8] Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM.

[9] Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.

[10] Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.

[11] Name: TV Phone

[0] Name: Attorney's Badge

[1] Name: Popper
Description: A classic party noisemaker. Pull the string, it goes "bang". Not very clue-worthy.

[2] Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: Set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected. Faces the lake.

[3] Name: Autopsy Report → Robert's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Cause: one bullet shot to the heart. Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Shot from approximately one meter away.

[4] Name: Lake Photo
Description: Taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. Click here for details.

[5] Name: Gourdy Article
Description: Article about a monster sighted at Gourd Lake. Click here for details.

[6] Name: Misty Fey's Photo
Description: An old photograph. "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" is written on the back.

[7] Name: Edgeworth's Request
Description: Document proving Edgeworth's request for an attorney.

[8] Name: Overhead Map
Description: Overhead map of Gourd Lake. Click here for details.

[9] Name: Pistol Bullet
Description: Found in the victim's body. Fired from a 22-caliber pistol. Found in the victim's body. The ballistic markings match the murder weapon's barrel.

[10] Name: Pistol
Description: The murder weapon. 22-caliber. Fired 3 times. Bears prints from Edgeworth's right hand.

[11] Name: Lotta's Deposition
Description: "I heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25."

[12] Name: Missile
Description: A K-9 unit in training. Very cute, with shiny eyes.

[13] Name: Fishing Pole
Description: Detective Gumshoe's personal fishing pole. Sadly flimsy and of dubious utility.

[14] Name: Metal Detector
Description: Makes a noise when metallic objects are near. A useful detection device.

[15] Name: Air Tank
Description: An empty air tank. The valve is open, and a banner of flags is wrapped around it.

[16] Name: Second Lake Photo
Description: Shows an empty lake. Taken automatically on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.

[17] Name: Parrot
Description: The erstwhile companion of the boat rental shop caretaker. Answers to the name "Polly".

[18] Name: DL-6 Case File
Description: File on the DL-6 Incident. Click here for details.

[19] Name: DL-6 Incident Photo
Description: Photograph of the scene of the murder. Click here for details.

[20] Name: Letter from the Safe
Description: "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth." This note details the murder and set up.

[21] Name: DL-6 Bullet
Description: Taken from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. Still bears clear ballistic markings.

[5] Name: Gourdy Article
Description: Article about a monster sighted at Gourd Lake. Click here for details.

[6] Name: Misty Fey's Photo

[7] Name: Edgeworth's Request
Description: Document proving Edgeworth's request for an attorney.

[8] Name: Overhead Map
Description: Overhead map of Gourd Lake. Click here for details.

[9] Name: Pistol Bullet
Description: Found in the victim's body. Fired from a 22-caliber pistol. Found in the victim's body. The ballistic markings match the murder weapon's barrel.

[10] Name: Pistol
Description: The murder weapon. 22-caliber. Fired 3 times. Bears prints from Edgeworth's right hand.

[11] Name: Lotta's Deposition
Description: "I heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25."

[12] Name: Missile
Description: A K-9 unit in training. Very cute, with shiny eyes.

[13] Name: Fishing Pole
Description: Detective Gumshoe's personal fishing pole. Sadly flimsy and of dubious utility.

[14] Name: Metal Detector
Description: Makes a noise when metallic objects are near. A useful detection device.

[16] Name: Second Lake Photo
Description: Shows an empty lake. Taken automatically on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.

[17] Name: Parrot

[18] Name: DL-6 Case File
