[21] Name: DL-6 Bullet
Description: Taken from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. Still bears clear ballistic markings.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: It's lonely, being alone on Christmas Eve!
[1] Testimony: That's why I was listening to an all-requests show on the radio, see?
[2] Testimony: I was listening to it real booming loud, like.
[3] Testimony: But I'm sure I heard that gunshot!
[4] Testimony: I remember exactly what the DJ was saying when I heard it, too.
[5] Testimony: Just when she said "Hey! It's almost Christmas!" I heard the gunshot!

The witness Butz is describing what he was doing on the lake at the night of crime.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a defense attorney.* (when playing as Athena Cykes) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

[1] Name: Arme's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Trauma to back of head caused by impact with a flat object. Time of death: Between 8 and 11 AM.

[2] Name: HH-3000 Bomb
Description: The time bomb that destroyed the courtroom. It was hidden inside a stuffed animal when it was detonated. It was hidden inside a stuffed animal and can be detonated remotely.

[3] Name: Phony Phanty Tail
Description: A piece of the stuffed animal that the bomb was inserted into. The defendant's fingerprints were found on it.

[4] Name: Bomb Transport Case
Description: The case Tonate and Detective Arme transported the bomb in. Tonate has the key.

[5] Name: Missing Remote Switch
Description: A switch that starts the time bomb's countdown. It was stolen just before the blast and is now missing.

[6] Name: Courtroom No. 4 Diagram
Description: A diagram of the courtroom as it was when Apollo was discovered after the assault. [caption] The rubble blocks off access to the area around the witness stand.

[7] Name: Apollo's Assault Photo
Description: Apollo is shown collapsed on the floor. The bloody writing is also visible. [caption] The writing is "L10015."

[8] Name: Courtroom Bombing Photo
Description: Crime scene photo of the aftermath of the Courtroom No. 4 bombing and the victim. [caption] The victim sits in front of some sharp and pointed rubbles. There is blood on the victim's head trickling down.

[9] Name: Bloody Writing Analysis
Description: A report that proves that the writing was done in Detective Arme's blood. [caption] The writing is "L10015."

[10] Name: Mr. Wright's Last Will
Description: "Apollo, sorry I got you caught up in all this. I leave the rest to you. Take good care of everyone, okay?"

[11] Name: Mr. Wright's Cell Phone
Description: The phone that delivered Mr. Wright's final message to me.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Postcard
Description: Lamiroir's own publicity postcard. Click here for details.

[2] Name: Lyrics Sheet
Description: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.

[3] Name: Investigation Request
Description: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.

[4] Name: Brooch
Description: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar... Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.

[5] Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon.  A deadly, high-caliber revolver. The murder weapon. A deadly, high-caliber revolver belonging to Mr. LeTouse.

[6] Name: Key Ring
Description: Mr. LeTouse died clutching this. Note the heart-shaped ring. Found in the victim's left hand. Holds keys to a guitar case and a motorcycle.

[7] Name: Mixing Board
Description: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.

[8] Name: LeTouse's Autopsy Report
Description: Death due to loss of blood from a gunshot wound. Est. time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: Victim shot in shoulder in Lamiroir's room. [caption] The victim was lying head down on the floor, his face turned to the left. There is smeared writing in blood on the floor in front of his head next to his right hand.

[10] Name: Diagram
Description: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. [caption] Observing from the door, the victim was blocked from sight by items. There was a gun next to the victim's body. Two bullet holes were found on the wall where the door was.

[11] Name: Video Tape
Description: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.

[12] Name: Headset
Description: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.

[13] Name: Switch → Remote Trigger
Description: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution.

[14] Name: Forum Diagram
Description: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.

[15] Name: Igniter
Description: Found at the crime scene. Emits a flame when triggered by remote control. Identical igniters in Gavin's guitar and at the crime scene. Triggered by "Remote Trigger".

[16] Name: Borginian Newspaper
Description: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.

[17] Name: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar
Description: A gift from Lamiroir, sent from Borginia. Burned the night of the concert.

[18] Name: Replica
Description: Replica of something, held by Mr. LeTouse. Apparently the focus of his investigation. Borginia Cocoon replica, held by Mr. LeTouse.

[19] Name: Newspaper Article
Description: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".

[20] Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: As for what I saw... I saw nothing.
[1] Testimony: That night, I was invited to sing on stage, and this I did.
[2] Testimony: I did not return backstage after the second set.
[3] Testimony: When my performance was finished, I went backstage for just a moment...
[4] Testimony: I saw nothing. The late Mr. LeTouse's body was behind a wall.
[5] Testimony: I saw bullet holes in the wall, and knew Mr. LeTouse had been shot...
[6] Testimony: Then I was led by the police to Mr. Gavin's dressing room, and told to wait there.
[7] Testimony: That was where I learned that something had happened... But I wasn't told the details.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Music Box Disk
Description: A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. The piece of music, which remains unidentified, is stored on the disk by means of small protrusions. A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. On the reverse side is a note that reads, 'For McGilded'.

[2] Name: White Cat Photograph → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Box)
Description: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat, obtained from Gina while interviewing her in her prison cell. A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank, in the form of some hand-written notes on the back of a photograph. It was a ticket meant for the pawning of a small music box owned by Magnus McGilded

[3] Name: Gina's Representation Papers
Description: The paperwork signed by Gina to put me in charge of her defence. Showing this to Scotland Yard detectives gains us access to the crime scene.

[4] Name: White Cat Photograph #2 → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Coat)
Description: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat. I feel as though I have another print just like this one... A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank. There's what looks like a bloody fingermark on it.

[5] Name: Blood Samples Portfolio
Description: A sample of blood analysed with a special chemical indicator developed by Mr Sholmes. Different people's blood turns different colours.

[6] Name: Iris's Story Manuscript
Description: A long, unpublished story that Mr Sholmes deposited at the pawnbrokery of the victim, Mr Windibank. It's entitled 'The Hound of the Baskervilles'.

[7] Name: McGilded Case Notes
Description: Notes collated by Miss Susato about the McGilded case that we worked on two months ago.

[8] Name: Today's Paper
Description: This morning's paper, purchased by Iris. Gina's case features prominently. This morning's paper, which contains an article about government secrets being leaked to foreign agencies.

[9] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner that confirms instant death due to a single bullet wound from the back. There are no other signs of trauma.

[10] Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the victim found murdered in the storeroom. It shows the single bullet wound in the man's back.

[11] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of Windibank's pawnbrokery, the scene of the crime. It shows the relative positions of the main shop and the rear storeroom.

[12] Name: Windibank's Gun
Description: A gun belonging to the victim, Mr Windibank, that Gina was holding when she was found unconscious. There are signs of a single discharge.

[13] Name: Skulkin Brothers' Gun
Description: A firearm found in the possession of the Skulkin brothers upon their arrest. There are signs that a single round was fired.

[14] Name: Photograph of Gina
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene a short time before the murder took place.

[15] Name: Post-Shooting Photograph
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene after the murder had taken place.

[16] Name: Stereoscope
Description: A fold-up device that allows anybody to enjoy seeing things in three dimensions simply by looking through the eyepieces.

[17] Name: Sholmes's Pouch
Description: The pouch Mr Sholmes was wearing around his waist at the time of the shooting. One of the glass phials is smashed and there are scorch marks around it.

[18] Name: The Third Bullet
Description: A projectile we discovered lodged in Mr Sholmes's pouch. It caused one of the phials to explode, injuring Mr Sholmes.

[19] Name: Small Music Box
Description: This strange music box only appears to be able to play a single tone. It was deposited at Windibank's two days before the black overcoat.

[20] Name: Cat-Flapomat
Description: A compact machine for the rapid creation of small flaps in larger doors, to allow cats to come and go freely.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Alright, we did knock a few things over. But we weren't riflin' fer nuffin'!
[1] Testimony: It woz when we 'eard the gunshot, see. Made us both jump, an' all that stuff went flyin'.
[2] Testimony: Just before the gunshot, we 'eard a voice yellin' out, 'Gimme that gun!'
[3] Testimony: The bloke wot owned the place was 'oldin' a gun, so 'e should 'ave just fired instead of yellin' at the girl!
[4] Testimony: Lummy, it didn't 'alf gimme a fright! We woz thinkin' the shooter'd come out the door and get us next.
[5] Testimony: We stuck everyfin' back where we found it and scarpered...straight into 'im in the black.
[6] Testimony: We couldn't 'ave shot the pawnbroker, see! We never even 'ad a chance, did we?
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Nash is testifying about the events surrounding the gunshot incident.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Naturally, I have occasion to make use of pawnbroking services from time to time.
[1] Testimony: But are you seriously suggesting I colluded with these thugs to break into the place on the night of the murder?
[2] Testimony: ...I have no intention of admitting to such an outrageous accusation.
[3] Testimony: Even if certain parties here present claim that my blood was found at the scene.
[4] Testimony: Some scaramouch detective's homebrewed tincture can hardly be taken as serious evidence.
[5] Testimony: The bottom line is, I've never had anything to do with the pawnbroking establishment where the man was killed!

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: A mere communications officer couldn't possibly steal confidential government information!
[1] Testimony: Besides, the sounds produced by that music box aren't even Morse code!
[2] Testimony: It was some low-class brickmaker negotiating with McGilded anyway, was it not? I've no relation to the man!
[3] Testimony: Look, all we dun is break into the gaff the other night like wot 'e told us to do!
[4] Testimony: If we'd known there woz dodgy gov'ment secrets involved, we wouldn't 'ave touched it!
[5] Testimony: 'Milverton & Skulkin's Milk Run'... Gor, them were the days!

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: While these ruffians were jostling with the broker, I was still near the entrance to the shop.
[1] Testimony: When Windibank threw Nash over the counter, I felt a sharp pain in my arm.
[2] Testimony: I pursued the man but he shut himself in the storeroom. I could see him through the peephole in the door, though.
[3] Testimony: The accused, in a black coat, shot the man in the back as he was trying to flee to safety!
[4] Testimony: I saw the blood spatter all over that wretched girl.
[5] Testimony: Then she tossed the gun out of the peephole. So I picked it up...and made my escape.

Description: The paperwork signed by Gina to put me in charge of her defence. Showing this to Scotland Yard detectives gains us access to the crime scene.

[4] Name: White Cat Photograph #2 → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Coat)
Description: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat. I feel as though I have another print just like this one... A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank. There's what looks like a bloody fingermark on it.

[5] Name: Blood Samples Portfolio
Description: A sample of blood analysed with a special chemical indicator developed by Mr Sholmes. Different people's blood turns different colours.

[6] Name: Iris's Story Manuscript
Description: A long, unpublished story that Mr Sholmes deposited at the pawnbrokery of the victim, Mr Windibank. It's entitled 'The Hound of the Baskervilles'.

[7] Name: McGilded Case Notes
Description: Notes collated by Miss Susato about the McGilded case that we worked on two months ago.

[8] Name: Today's Paper
Description: This morning's paper, purchased by Iris. Gina's case features prominently. This morning's paper, which contains an article about government secrets being leaked to foreign agencies.

[9] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner that confirms instant death due to a single bullet wound from the back. There are no other signs of trauma.

[10] Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the victim found murdered in the storeroom. It shows the single bullet wound in the man's back.

[11] Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of Windibank's pawnbrokery, the scene of the crime. It shows the relative positions of the main shop and the rear storeroom.

[12] Name: Windibank's Gun
Description: A gun belonging to the victim, Mr Windibank, that Gina was holding when she was found unconscious. There are signs of a single discharge.

[13] Name: Skulkin Brothers' Gun
Description: A firearm found in the possession of the Skulkin brothers upon their arrest. There are signs that a single round was fired.

[14] Name: Photograph of Gina
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene a short time before the murder took place.

[15] Name: Post-Shooting Photograph
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene after the murder had taken place.

[16] Name: Stereoscope
Description: A fold-up device that allows anybody to enjoy seeing things in three dimensions simply by looking through the eyepieces.

[17] Name: Sholmes's Pouch
Description: The pouch Mr Sholmes was wearing around his waist at the time of the shooting. One of the glass phials is smashed and there are scorch marks around it.

[18] Name: The Third Bullet
Description: A projectile we discovered lodged in Mr Sholmes's pouch. It caused one of the phials to explode, injuring Mr Sholmes.

[19] Name: Small Music Box
Description: This strange music box only appears to be able to play a single tone. It was deposited at Windibank's two days before the black overcoat.

[20] Name: Cat-Flapomat
Description: A compact machine for the rapid creation of small flaps in larger doors, to allow cats to come and go freely.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: While these ruffians were jostling with the broker, I was still near the entrance to the shop.
[1] Testimony: When Windibank threw Nash over the counter, I felt a sharp pain in my arm.
[2] Testimony: I pursued the man but he shut himself in the storeroom. I could see him through the peephole in the door, though.
[3] Testimony: The accused, in a black coat, shot the man in the back as he was trying to flee to safety!
[4] Testimony: I saw the blood spatter all over that wretched girl.
[5] Testimony: Then she tossed the gun out of the peephole. So I picked it up...and made my escape.


Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.

[2] Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.

[3] Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)

[4] Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.

[5] Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.

[6] Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.

[7] Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.

[8] Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.

[9] Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.

[10] Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.

[11] Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.

[12] Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.

[13] Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.

[14] Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

[15] Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

[16] Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)

[17] Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

[18] Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.

[19] Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.

[20] Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I went to the robotics lab at about 2 PM for my regular recharge!
[1] Testimony: Just as I was about to charge up, Athena came in and hugged Mommy Metis!
[2] Testimony: And then Mommy Metis fell down. After that, I was recharging, so I don't know anything.
[3] Testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!
[4] Testimony: After I charged up, I was cleaning the room, and Mr. Simon came in.
[5] Testimony: And then an error occurred. There is no data after that point.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Ponco, who is a robot created by the victim Metis, describes when the victim died.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Ha ha ha ha! I am the very embodiment of justice itself!
[1] Testimony: I won't have you make me into a villain with your far-fetched arguments!
[2] Testimony: And this bit about the escape route is only a theory -- you don't have any proof!
[3] Testimony: What we DO have is proof that Athena Cykes is the culprit: this lighter with her prints on it!
[4] Testimony: Three prints were on the lighter: the thumb, index, and middle fingers of a right hand!
[5] Testimony: The prints were placed just the way they would be if someone were holding it lit.
[6] Testimony: Ms. Blackquill was extremely crabby about having her work interrupted!
[7] Testimony: The lab was very messy, so it was actually kind of a poor choice for the evacuation...

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.
[1] Testimony: Yes, I'm very afraid of him because he took my family hostage.
[2] Testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!
[3] Testimony: So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!
[4] Testimony: In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The phantom is a killer who stole the moon rock, a valuable artifact, and killed Dr. Cykes seven years ago. The killer had been at large since because no incriminating evidence was found.

Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.

[13] Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.

[14] Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

[15] Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

[16] Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)

[17] Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

[18] Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.

[19] Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.

[20] Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.
[1] Testimony: Yes, I'm very afraid of him because he took my family hostage.
[2] Testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!
[3] Testimony: So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!
[4] Testimony: In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!

Summarized context:
The phantom is a killer who stole the moon rock, a valuable artifact, and killed Dr. Cykes seven years ago. The killer had been at large since because no incriminating evidence was found.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

[1] Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin.

[2] Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)

[3] Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor.

[4] Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.

[5] Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)

[6] Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!

[7] Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.

[8] Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM.

[9] Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.

[10] Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.

[11] Name: TV Phone
Description: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing. Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks.

[12] Name: Shipley's Data
Description: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. [info] Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Bruised all over body. Death thought to be result of orca attack. Estimated Time of Death: Under Investigation. Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated. [info] Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool. Bruised all over. Ceiling to pool bottom is 100 ft. Blow to head received after death.

[13] Name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
Description: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.

[14] Name: Security Card
Description: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.

[15] Name: Prescription Bag
Description: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.

[16] Name: Skull Rock
Description: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death. A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell.

[17] Name: Pool Bottom Photo
Description: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in. [caption] The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass.

[18] Name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
Description: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it. The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.

[19] Name: Handmade Sign
Description: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.

[20] Name: Ladder Prints
Description: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.

[21] Name: Charm
Description: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.

[22] Name: TORPEDO Data
Description: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: In the early morning hours of July 20th, Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
[1] Testimony: Sasha and Jack Shipley, the owner, were scheduled to do the cleaning together.
[2] Testimony: The record of card usage shows that Sasha entered the orca pool room.
[3] Testimony: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

[1] Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within.

[2] Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.

[3] Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.

[4] Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.

[5] Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.

[6] Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."

[7] Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.

[8] Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.

[9] Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.

[10] Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.

[11] Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.

[12] Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.

[13] Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.

[14] Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.

[15] Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.

[16] Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.

[17] Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.

[18] Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.

[19] Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.

[20] Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.

[21] Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.

[22] Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.

[23] Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.

[24] Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.

[25] Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.

[26] Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.

[27] Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.

[28] Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.

[29] Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I was struck by a sudden dizziness the moment I entered the tomb.
[1] Testimony: The next thing I knew, I was standing there with a bloody knife in my hand.
[2] Testimony: The possibility of a third party being there in the tomb is probably nonexistent.
[3] Testimony: And lying right in front of me was Inga, dead as a doornail.
[4] Testimony: I've no recollection of what happened in the interim.
[5] Testimony: I don't have a motive for killing Inga. After all, me and my ilk seek a bloodless revolution.
[6] Testimony: But I didn't kill him. At least, I don't think I did. It'd go against everything I believe in.
[7] Testimony: Though, I guess there's no evidence that proves I didn't kill him either...
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Dhurke describes the situation in the tomb, where he and Inga the victim were found. No blood of either person was found in the tomb.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

[1] Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.

[2] Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.

[3] Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.

[4] Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.

[5] Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.

[6] Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.

[7] Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"

[8] Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.

[9] Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.

[10] Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.

[11] Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.

[12] Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.

[13] Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.

[14] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.

[15] Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.

[16] Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The victim planned to get his revenge on Troupe Gramarye during Trucy's magic show.
[1] Testimony: Mr. Reus was going to first steal the Gramarye notebook from the defendant.
[2] Testimony: He then intended to reveal the secrets behind their magic tricks during the show.
[3] Testimony: That was the victim's plan for revenge. And while he did, in fact, steal the notebook...
[4] Testimony: ...the defendant murdered him before he had a chance to reveal the secrets.
[5] Testimony: The defendant's prints were on the tape. I guess she must've moved it during the show.
input.summarized_context:

The witness Detective Ema explains why Trucy the defendant was accused of the murder.

The witness Detective Ema explains why Trucy the defendant was accused of the murder.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

[1] Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.

[2] Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.

[3] Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.

[4] Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.

[5] Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.

[6] Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.

[7] Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"

[8] Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.

[9] Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.

[10] Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.

[11] Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.

[12] Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.

[13] Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.

[14] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.

[15] Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.

[16] Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: It's true. I had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick.
[1] Testimony: It was the fire trick, right? The one Mr. Reus was supposed to do?
[2] Testimony: That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it.
[3] Testimony: I-It was in the script... and I really wanted to see it... but I couldn't because of the accident.
[4] Testimony: Shut up! You're gonna give it away! ...Anyway, I was real busy.
[5] Testimony: Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus...
input.summarized_context:

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

[1] Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

[2] Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.

[3] Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.

[4] Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.

[5] Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.

[6] Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)

[7] Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

[8] Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.

[9] Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)

[10] Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.

[11] Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.

[12] Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.

[13] Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.

[14] Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

[15] Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.

[16] Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together.
[1] Testimony: We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside.
[2] Testimony: We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor.
[3] Testimony: I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck.
[4] Testimony: Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Cosmos describes the scene of the crime.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

[1] Name: The Thinker
Description: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz. Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.

[2] Name: Glass Shards
Description: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.

[3] Name: Receipt
Description: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back. Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.

[4] Name: Maya's Memo
Description: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."

[5] Name: Mia's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous. Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.

[6] Name: Maya's Cell Phone
Description: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.

[7] Name: Wiretap
Description: Found in Miss May's hotel room.

[8] Name: Floor Plans
Description: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. [caption] The stand is blocked from view looking from the office.

[9] Name: May Testimony
Description: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."

[10] Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.

[11] Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.

[12] Name: Bellboy's Affidavit
Description: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.

[13] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.

[14] Name: Mia's Memo
Description: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Let's see, it was about 9:00, I believe.
[1] Testimony: I was quietly perusifying... er, that's "reading" to you, some papers by the window.
[2] Testimony: Then I heard a bedlam coming from outside!
[3] Testimony: Surprised, I turned to look at the building across the way.
[4] Testimony: It was then I saw him: a spiky-haired man attacking a woman with long hair!
[5] Testimony: Needless to say that man was none other than you, Mr. Lawyer!
[6] Testimony: I called Miss May over at once. She, too, was surprised of course.
[7] Testimony: The victim, she... she ran away, but you gave chase!
[8] Testimony: The victim ran to the left, and you gave chase!
[9] Testimony: Finally there was a terrible impaction! Then it was all over...

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner. It gives the cause of death as internal haemorrhaging as a result of a single stab wound to the abdomen.

[2] Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the victim taken on the omnibus. The knife in his abdomen is clearly visible, but his face is partly obscured from view by an old, crooked hat.

[3] Name: Defendant's Leather Gloves
Description: The leather gloves the defendant was wearing at the time of the incident. There is a bloodstain on the right glove.

[4] Name: Omnibus
Description: The eight-seater omnibus that was the scene of the crime. There were passengers both inside the carriage and on the roof deck that night. The scene of the crime. There is a bloodstain visible on the frame of the skylight when it's open.

[5] Name: Murder Weapon
Description: A largish knife that was found lodged in the victim's abdomen. Its quality and fancy ornamentation suggest it must be quite valuable.

[6] Name: Debtors' Ledger
Description: A catalogue of people who had borrowed money from the defendant at a high rate of interest. It includes the victim, who owed twenty guineas. Among the defendant's list of debtors is Bruce Fairplay, who would have been due to repay his loan imminently.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I, I only c-carried f-four passengers that night! I swear it! ...B-B-But, um...
[1] Testimony: Well, I for one was told I had to pay fivepence for the bus.
[2] Testimony: He fiddled us on the fare, he did! And then I saw that blood-curdling sight as well... It's all too much!
[3] Testimony: I tell you, I saw McGilded stabbing that man! Everything I said before stands!
[4] Testimony: Oh yes... Yes, he s-s-stabbed him. Yes he did. ...I, I think so, yes.
[5] Testimony: D'you think I'd forget the sight of those blood-soaked hands after that butcher stabbed the man?!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Furst, Fairplay, and Beppo are testifying about what they saw on the omnibus when the murder happened.

[3] Name: Defendant's Leather Gloves
Description: The leather gloves the defendant was wearing at the time of the incident. There is a bloodstain on the right glove.

[4] Name: Omnibus
Description: The eight-seater omnibus that was the scene of the crime. There were passengers both inside the carriage and on the roof deck that night. The scene of the crime. There is a bloodstain visible on the frame of the skylight when it's open.

[5] Name: Murder Weapon
Description: A largish knife that was found lodged in the victim's abdomen. Its quality and fancy ornamentation suggest it must be quite valuable.

[6] Name: Debtors' Ledger
Description: A catalogue of people who had borrowed money from the defendant at a high rate of interest. It includes the victim, who owed twenty guineas. Among the defendant's list of debtors is Bruce Fairplay, who would have been due to repay his loan imminently.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: We were the only two people up on that roof deck, dead or alive! ...I can swear to that!
[1] Testimony: If anything had happened where we were sitting, don't you think one or the other of us would have noticed?
[2] Testimony: In any case, neither of us know the first thing about the victim. We had no reason to kill the man!
[3] Testimony: The skylight was shut the entire time, I tell you! We couldn't possibly have opened it!
[4] Testimony: If you're so sure the victim fell through the skylight, where's your proof?

Summarized context:
The witness Fairplay and Furst are testifying about the possibility that the victim fell through the skylight.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

[2] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A picture of the crime scene. [caption] A person is lying face down on a big box in the snow. There are footprints leading to where he is.

[3] Name: Silk Hat
Description: Made-to-order fedora that is a symbol of Max's fabulousness. Found at the crime scene.

[4] Name: Max G. Promo Poster
Description: Emblazoned with Max's three famous symbols. A silk hat, cloak and white roses.

[5] Name: Ringmaster's Papers
Description: Documents related to Max's salary negotiations. He got an enormous raise 1 week ago.

[6] Name: Circus Map
Description: A map of the Berry Big Circus. The circus is depicted on the left. The ring master’s room and cafeteria are on the northeast of the circus. To the right is the lodging house. Moe is on the first floor and Acro is on the third.

[7] Name: Broken Bottle
Description: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.

[8] Name: Trilo Quist
Description: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.

[9] Name: Money the Monkey
Description: A monkey who takes care of Acro. Habitually gathers all sorts of shiny objects.

[10] Name: Ring
Description: A cheap ring with an eerie sparkle. "From T to R" is engraved on it.

[11] Name: Russell's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10:15 PM. Cause: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head.

[12] Name: Wooden Box
Description: The victim was hunched over this 20 lb. box. It was locked by a small key.

[13] Name: Small Seasoning Bottle
Description: Found inside the Wooden Box the victim was hunched over. It contains pepper.

[14] Name: Grand Prix Photo
Description: Photo of Max's Award Ceremony. Max is standing at the center holding a trophy. Two girls stand to either side. The bust of max is right next to him.

[15] Name: Max G. Bust
Description: Bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. It looks rather heavy.

[16] Name: Note
Description: Posted in the Cafeteria on the day of the crime, then torn. States: "To The Murderer!" Torn by Ringmaster, found in his tailcoat pocket. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza.

[17] Name: Stage Costume
Description: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.

[18] Name: Léon
Description: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.

[19] Name: Scarf
Description: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust.
[1] Testimony: I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured.
[2] Testimony: However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible.
[3] Testimony: There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body.
[4] Testimony: That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head.
[5] Testimony: Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Acro explains why he could lift up the bust, but could not look out of the window to know where the victim's head was.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

[1] Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.

[2] Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.

[3] Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.

[4] Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.

[5] Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]

[6] Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.

[7] Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".

[9] Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".

[10] Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".

[11] Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.

[12] Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.

[13] Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.

[14] Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.

[15] Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.

[16] Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.

[17] Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.

[18] Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I wanted to see a Steel Samurai rehearsal, just once.
[1] Testimony: I found a map on the Internet, and went to the studios that day.
[2] Testimony: I went through the woods, off the path, so that old lady wouldn't catch me.
[3] Testimony: I was going for the studio.
[4] Testimony: I got kinda lost on the way, though. For about 30 minutes.
[5] Testimony: When I came out by the studio, there was the Steel Samurai!
[6] Testimony: It totally rocked! Right before my eyes, out came the bad guy!
[7] Testimony: Of course, the Steel Samurai took him down! Pow!
[8] Testimony: If I had my camera with me, that woulda been the time for a shot, I tell you.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Cody is a die-hard fan of the Steel Samurai. He is testifying about what he saw when he snuck into the studio to see a rehearsal.

input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: That day, I had gone to the courtroom to observe one of my father's trials.
[1] Testimony: As we went to leave, an earthquake struck, trapping us in the elevator.
[2] Testimony: My father and Mr. Yogi lost their composure, and began to argue.
[3] Testimony: Just then, something heavy fell at my feet.
[4] Testimony: I picked it up, and threw it at Mr. Yogi. I wanted them to stop fighting.
[5] Testimony: A moment later, there was a single gunshot, then a scream.
[6] Testimony: It was a terrible scream. I remember it to this day.

The witness Edgeworth is remembering what happened in the DL-6 case years ago.

[17] Name: Parrot

[18] Name: DL-6 Case File

[19] Name: DL-6 Incident Photo

[20] Name: Letter from the Safe

[21] Name: DL-6 Bullet

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: That day, I had gone to the courtroom to observe one of my father's trials.
[1] Testimony: As we went to leave, an earthquake struck, trapping us in the elevator.
[2] Testimony: My father and Mr. Yogi lost their composure, and began to argue.
[3] Testimony: Just then, something heavy fell at my feet.
[4] Testimony: I picked it up, and threw it at Mr. Yogi. I wanted them to stop fighting.
[5] Testimony: A moment later, there was a single gunshot, then a scream.
[6] Testimony: It was a terrible scream. I remember it to this day.

Summarized context:
The witness Edgeworth is remembering what happened in the DL-6 case years ago.

[2] Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm

[3] Name: Nine-Tails Flower

[4] Name: Special Edition Paper

[5] Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.

[6] Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.

[7] Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted.

[8] Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.

[10] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.

[11] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.

[12] Name: Jinxie's Statement

[13] Name: TV Listings

[14] Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.

[15] Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.

[16] Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

[17] Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.

[18] Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.

[19] Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.

[20] Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.

Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

[17] Name: Forbidden Chamber Key

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

[1] Name: Magic Show Ticket
Description: For premier showing of a grand illusion, to be performed by the magician, Valant Gramarye.

[2] Name: Gramarye Envelope
Description: Envelope from Mr. Wright. Do not open until the time is right.

[3] Name: Vera's Card
Description: Defendant's business card. The address for Drew Studio is on the front.

[4] Name: Portrait
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. That bit in the middle is supposed to be a person.

[5] Name: Acrylic
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. An undersea scene in vivid colors.

[6] Name: Landscape
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. Only half finished, the rough sketch is still visible.

[7] Name: Coffee Mug
Description: The victim's last mug of coffee. The scrawl on the side is Drew Misham's signature. Traces of the slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine were found on the rim.

[8] Name: Hidden Painting
Description: Found at Drew Studio. Notable for the large peach in the foreground.

[9] Name: Red Envelope
Description: Found in the victim's desk drawer. Appears to have been opened once and resealed. Found in the victim's desk drawer. Contains two sheets of writing paper.

[10] Name: Letter Box
Description: Drew Misham's contact with the outside world. It's empty.

[11] Name: Tiny Frame
Description: Frame measuring two inches by two inches. Bears traces of deadly poison atroquinine.

[12] Name: Brushel's Card
Description: This business card reads "Spark Brushel, Freelance Journalist".

[13] Name: Misham's Autopsy Report
Description: Death by atroquinine poisoning. Estimated time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.

[14] Name: Crime Photo
Description: Body found in hospital room, shot in the forehead. Click here for details.

[15] Name: Magnifi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: single gunshot to the head. Estimated time of death: 11:00-11:30 PM.

[16] Name: Notebook Page
Description: Mysterious paper received just before the trial. Click here for details. Forged to look like a page of Magnifi's diary. Click here for details.

[17] Name: Magnifi's Chart
Description: Diagnosed with a malignant tumor. Given 3 months. Click here for details.

[18] Name: Small Syringe
Description: Used for administering insulin shots. Has been washed and shows no sign of use.

[19] Name: Magnifi's Letter
Description: Letter asking Zak to shoot him. Click here for details.

[20] Name: Stage Pistol
Description: Fires one real bullet. Rifling marks match bullet found in victim. No fingerprints found.

[21] Name: Magnifi's Letter 2
Description: Letter telling Valant to come at 11:20 PM. Click here for details.

[22] Name: IV Report
Description: IV stopped 10 min. after administration began. Click here for details.

[23] Name: Magnifi's Diary
Description: A memoir of sorts. Written in up to just before he died.

[24] Name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
Description: Trucy's favorite trick. Startlingly realistic.

[25] Name: Trucy's Locket
Description: Contains a photo of Trucy's mother, Thalassa.

[26] Name: Transferal of Rights
Description: Document tranferring the right to perform the Gramarye repertoire to daughter Trucy.

[27] Name: Nail Polish
Description: Retrieved from Kristoph Gavin's cell. The nail polish is colorless.

[28] Name: Commemorative Stamp
Description: Commemorative stamp showing Troupe Gramarye. Click here for details. Sent from the real "client". Click here for details.

[29] Name: Thalassa's Portrait
Description: Photo of a young Thalassa, Trucy's mother. Click here for details.

[30] Name: Zak's Confession
Description: Confession to the slaying of Magnifi Gramarye. Click here for details.

[31] Name: Letter from Misham
Description: Letter posted by Drew Misham just before dying. Poison traces found on the stamp.

[32] Name: Letter from Mr. Wright
Description: Reproduction of information found by Mr. Wright during his investigation.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I visited the studio around 9:00 that night to do the interview.
[1] Testimony: The first outsider to enter the atelier! "Journalistic History Made", end quote!
[2] Testimony: His daughter brought us coffee right after we started.
[3] Testimony: And you know what happened next. "Star Falls!" end quote.
[4] Testimony: Those spasms... That was definitely death by poison.
[5] Testimony: I drank the coffee, too, but I'm not dead yet!
[6] Testimony: He had one sip, if that. The next moment, he was on the floor!
[7] Testimony: No one else entered the room besides her the whole time.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

[1] Name: The Thinker
Description: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz. Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.

[2] Name: Glass Shards
Description: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.

[3] Name: Receipt
Description: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back. Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.

[4] Name: Maya's Memo
Description: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."

[5] Name: Mia's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous. Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.

[6] Name: Maya's Cell Phone
Description: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.

[7] Name: Wiretap
Description: Found in Miss May's hotel room.

[8] Name: Floor Plans
Description: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.

[9] Name: May Testimony
Description: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."

[10] Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.

[11] Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.

[12] Name: Bellboy's Affidavit
Description: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.

[13] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.

[14] Name: Mia's Memo
Description: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: After securing the suspect, I examined the scene of the crime with my own eyes.
[1] Testimony: I found a memo written on a piece of paper next to the victim's body!
[2] Testimony: On it, the word "Maya" was written clearly in blood!
[3] Testimony: Lab test results showed that the blood was the victim's!
[4] Testimony: Also, there was blood found on the victim's finger!
[5] Testimony: Before she died, the victim wrote the killer's name!

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Cell Phone
Description: I found this in my pocket, but I don't remember what it means or how it got there. Maggey found this in the park. She got in contact with its owner, but they never showed.

[2] Name: Dustin's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/6 at 6:28 PM. Cause: Broken neck. Body was also covered in bruises.

[3] Name: Glasses
Description: Found under the victim's body. Pieces of near-sighted lenses were found nearby.

[4] Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The victim fell from the walking path above. The photo shows the body of Dustin Prince as he was found after being pushed from the upper area of the park. There is a phone booth in the background.

[5] Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: A photo of the area around the victim's hand. It shows the body of Dustin Prince having written 'Maggie' in the sand.

[6] Name: Baseball Glove
Description: A birthday present from Maggey to the victim. It was custom-made. [caption] It was made to be worn on the right hand. Looks kind of like a banana.

[7] Name: Phoenix's Business Card
Description: It's my business card. I handwrote my cell phone number on the back.

[8] Name: Names List
Description: A list of unfamiliar names and phone numbers. Members of a con artists' group...? A list of con artists and their phone numbers stored on the cell phone Maggey found.

[9] Name: Judge's Business Card
Description: It's written in fancy script. The ink is strong and clear, but I still can't read it.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: We first looked into the handwriting.
[1] Testimony: Unfortunately, we couldn't confirm that it was the victim's handwriting.
[2] Testimony: Next, we checked the victim's pointer finger.
[3] Testimony: We found that there was sand trapped under the victim's fingernail.
[4] Testimony: There were also scratches on the skin that were caused by him writing on the ground.
[5] Testimony: From this, we could confirm that the victim wrote this name with his right hand.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
Detective Gumshoe is explaining why the police thinks the victim wrote the name in blood.

[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.

[2] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

[3] Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.

[4] Name: Folding Screen

Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.

[6] Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. [info] This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...?

[10] Name: Knife

[0] Testimony: Like, around that time, I was, like, really close to getting my license.
[1] Testimony: My sis was, like, this totally big fan of cars and, like, really valued them.
[2] Testimony: She, like, had just gotten this really shiny, bright red sports car.
[3] Testimony: My sis' new car was, like, a totally special model from England.
[4] Testimony: She, like, would say things like, "No way am I letting a newb drive my car!"

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My attorney's badge. It's lost that "brand-new" shine, but that just shows how far I've come.

[1] Name: Backstage Diagram
Description: Diagram of the backstage area showing the location of the stage, the dressing room, and the yard. [caption] The door to the dressing room and the door to the yard face one another. When the door of the yard is open, the door blocks the view from the yard to the dressing room.

[2] Name: Crime Scene Report
Description: The crime scene took place in the theater dressing room. Master Toneido was found with his face thrust into a large soba bowl. Contains photos of the crime scene. The victim's dying message is clearly visible in them. Includes additional info.

[3] Name: Taifu's Autopsy Report
Description: The time of death is between 2 PM and 5 PM. The cause of death is suffocation. It reads: Time of death: May 12, 2 PM - 5 PM; Cause of death: Suffocation. Nothing was found in his lungs.

[4] Name: Whet Soba Deed
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It's the deed to the soba shop. The deed holder is Bucky Whet.

[5] Name: Invitation
Description: The invitation Simon received from Master Toneido to the show commemorating Uendo's name succession and promotion. It states that the show "Time Soba" was to be performed by Master Toneido himself.

[6] Name: Simon's Statement
Description: Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Includes additional info.

[7] Name: Karuta Cards
Description: Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They spell out "WHET NO 4." Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They originally spelt out "OWEN 4TH" as shown.

[8] Name: Taifu's Note
Description: A note thought to have been written by the victim before his death.
input.testimonies:

[0] Testimony: From 4 PM to a little after 4:20 PM, when Shisho's body was found...
[1] Testimony: ...Simon and I were standing in the hallway in front of the dressing room.
[2] Testimony: Before Uendo discovered the body, the only person who had gone in there was Bucky.
[3] Testimony: Come to think of it, a little while before Bucky showed up, Jugemu was barking like mad!
[4] Testimony: I was in the yard, but the door was wide open, so I could keep watch on the dressing room.
