Evidence:
[0] Name: University Collar Pin
Description: Proof that I'm a student at the Imperial Yumei University. I always wear it on the collar of my uniform jacket.

[1] Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.

[2] Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.

[0] Testimony: 'I had arranged to meet for a slightly late luncheon with Dr Wilson that day.'
[1] Testimony: 'The professor was unable to eat, so I ordered for myself only. A beef steak.'
[2] Testimony: 'I ordered a beef steak for myself, and the professor and I said "cheers" over a glass of carbonated water.'

[4] Testimony: 'Then, not long afterwards, the accused took the professor's gun, and shot him right before my eyes!'
[5] Testimony: 'I don't carry a gun myself, so obviously I couldn't have been the culprit.'

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.

[2] Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.

[3] Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.

[4] Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.

[5] Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime. [caption] At the juncture of the corridor, to the north is a dead end with a phone. To the south is the foyer. To the east is the corridor that leads to the Fox Chamber. There is an airduct connecting that corridor to the Fox Chamber.

[6] Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.

[7] Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted.

[8] Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood.

[10] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.

[11] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.

[12] Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.

[13] Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster.

[14] Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.

[15] Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.

[16] Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

[17] Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.

[18] Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.

[19] Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.

[20] Name: Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Tenma Taro's really that little maid gal. Ain't no doubt about it!
[1] Testimony: I mean, the Tenma Taro I saw was just a lil' thing 'bout her size!
[2] Testimony: But the little runt had a big ol' staff. I seen it when she came into the foyer!
[3] Testimony: Betcha she stole it from the Forbidden Chamber after stumbling on the crime scene.
[4] Testimony: She was gonna use it to wallop me on account o' my fierce reputation, I just know it!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness filch claims that Tenma Taro stole a staff from the Forbidden Chamber, which was locked when the crime happened.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

[1] Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.

[2] Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.

[3] Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.

[4] Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.

[5] Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime. [caption] At the juncture of the corridor, to the north is a dead end with a phone. To the south is the foyer. To the east is the corridor that leads to the Fox Chamber. There is an airduct connecting that corridor to the Fox Chamber.

[6] Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.

[7] Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted.

[8] Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood.

[10] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.

[11] Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.

[12] Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.

[13] Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster.

[14] Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.

[15] Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.

[16] Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

[17] Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.

[18] Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.

[19] Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.

[20] Name: Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: I was in the hallway, HIDING in the shadows. THAT'S when I heard the confession.
[1] Testimony: Upon LEARNING of her father's crime, little Jinxie fled without EVER noticing me.
[2] Testimony: Immediately AFTER that, the mayor came to, stood up and opened the Forbidden Chamber!
[3] Testimony: As I ran in TERROR, the demon emerged from his prison!
[4] Testimony: In shock, I FLED down the hallway to my right -- the one with the PHONE at the end.
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness L'Belle describes how he fled the scene at the sight of the demon.

Description: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.

[18] Name: Léon
Description: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.

[19] Name: Scarf
Description: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.

[0] Testimony: There's no doubt in my mind! There were no white roses that night!

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

[2] Name: The Nickel Samurai
Description: A glossy photo Maya pushed onto me. A picture describing the nickel samurai costume.

[3] Name: Press Conference Ticket
Description: Seems like the Nickel Samurai is to confess something after the post-ceremony stage show.

[4] Name: Radio Transceiver
Description: Originally from the Bellboy. It can transmit and receive signals over great distances. Originally from Maya's kidnapper, who goes by the name of "De Killer".

[5] Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: A very expensive item valued at $1,600. It was stolen around the time of the murder. Stolen on the night of the murder. Tabloid article about the victim was in the case.

[6] Name: Hotel Guidemap
Description: Map of the Gatewater Hotel around the crime scene. A path from the west leads to the viola hall. To the north of the path is engarde and to the south corrida. East of viola hall is the lobby.

[7] Name: Guitar Case
Description: Found next to the victim. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Empty. There is some water, but only on top of the lid. Bears Corrida's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Wine Glass
Description: Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. No sign it's been drank. Found next to the victim. It's filled with tomato juice. Bears Andrews' fingerprints.

[9] Name: Crime Photo
Description: Photo of Juan Corrida's murder scene. The victim sits on a chair in a samurai outfit. There is a stab wound on his chest. A glass of juice sits behind him on the dresser. A full bottle of juice sits on the desk in front of him. A open guitar case lies on the floor next to him. Next to the guitar case are the remains of a smashed vase that has stained the carpet with water.

[10] Name: Autograph
Description: Juan Corrida's autograph. "To my dearest Wendy" is written on it.

[11] Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An "article" from the tabloid "Gossip Land". The contents of the article follow: *Jammin' Midnight Rendezvous!?*

A super-star in an ultra-hot, mega-secret
love scandal!?

Reliable sources say that Juan Corrida
has been getting in close with the
mysterious, yet beautiful manager to the
stars, Ms. A.A.!


[12] Name: Suicide Report
Description: Deceased: Celeste InpaxFound by: Juan CorridaWas her suicide note hidden?

[13] Name: Attempted Suicide Report
Description: Attempter: Adrian AndrewsReason: Shock from Celeste Inpax's suicide.

[14] Name: Juan's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 8:15 PMCause: Strangled with a scarf, then stabbed with a knife.

[15] Name: Knife
Description: Bears the victim's blood and Engarde's fingerprints. In the grip, "Gatewater" is engraved.

[16] Name: Jammin' Ninja's Button
Description: Was ripped from his costume. Is covered in Corrida's blood. Found in Engarde's "hakama".

[17] Name: Lotta's Photo
Description: Picture taken in the Hallway right after the murder. A person in samurai garb stands outside the door.

[18] Name: Picture Card
Description: Was placed next to the victim at the time of the murder. Ms. Andrews was carrying it.

[19] Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: Received from Edgeworth. Allows bearer to freely investigate the crime scene.

[20] Name: Matt's Note
Description: "Please feed my cat, Shoe. My house is just a little ways down from the hotel."

[21] Name: Spy Camera
Description: Set to record the victim's room from 8 PM for 1 hour. Was running at time of murder.

[22] Name: Transmitter
Description: Changes the footage taken by the spy camera into radio waves and transmits the data.

[23] Name: Stuffed Bear
Description: The spy camera was set in its right eye. Found in the victim's room.

[24] Name: Credit Card Receipt
Description: A receipt for $3,800. Proof Engarde bought a stuffed bear identical to one in evidence.

[25] Name: Figurine
Description: A wooden bear-shaped figurine. It's covered in many thin cuts. A wooden puzzle with a hollow inside. Only Corrida and Andrews know how to open it.

[26] Name: Celeste's Photo
Description: Found at Engarde Mansion. "With Love... Celeste" is written on it.

[27] Name: Celeste's Suicide Note
Description: Found inside the Figurine. It tells of Engarde's horrible misdeeds.

[28] Name: Pistol
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> A small caliber pistol that is thought to have been fired by De Killer at Franziska.

[29] Name: Video Tape
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.  <if asked for details> One of the items retrieved. De Killer violently tried to recover it. Contents unknown.

[30] Name: Bellboy's Uniform
Description: <if not asked for details> One of the items retrieved from De Killer's hideout. Nothing else is known.<if asked for details> Worn by De Killer on the night of the murder. One of its special buttons is missing.

[31] Name: Whip
Description: Thrown away by Franziska von Karma, it has a certain mysterious nostalgia to it.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: This time, I was in that hallway because I had to go to the bathroom!
[1] Testimony: And that's when that bellboy I saw earlier came out of the room!
[2] Testimony: Of course, when I say "room", I mean Juan Corrida's room!
[3] Testimony: Now that I think about it, that bellboy did seem kinda out of place!
[4] Testimony: I thought it was kinda strange for a bellboy to come out of a guest's room empty-handed!
[5] Testimony: Yeah! So he had to be the assassin! I'm sure of it!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Powers is describing why he thinks the bellboy may be the killer who killed Juan Corrida in his hotel room.

input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

[1] Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

[2] Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1. The two sections are connected by a passage between the mid level of Launch Pad 1 and the 3rd-floor lounge of the main building. Launch Pad 1 consists of three levels: upper, mid, and lower. There are two ways to descend from the upper to the mid level—via an elevator or a ladder. The main building has a total of six floors.

[3] Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.

[4] Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.

[5] Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.

[6] Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)

[7] Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

[8] Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.

[9] Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)

[10] Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.

[11] Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.

[12] Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.

[13] Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.

[14] Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

[15] Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.

[16] Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.
input.testimonies:

[0] Testimony: All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!
[1] Testimony: Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor.
[2] Testimony: Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate.
[3] Testimony: I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.

[2] Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.

[3] Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd.

[4] Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.

[5] Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.

[6] Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen.

[7] Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.

[8] Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.

[9] Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"

[10] Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.

[11] Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.

[12] Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.

[13] Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.

[14] Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.

[15] Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.

[16] Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.

[17] Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.

[18] Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

[19] Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!

[20] Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".

[21] Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!

[22] Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.

[23] Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program.

[24] Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.

[25] Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.

[26] Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.

[27] Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
[1] Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
[2] Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
[3] Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
[4] Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
input.summarized_context:
Summarized context:
The witness Armstrong is the owner of the restaurant where the murder took place. He is testifying about where the old man Victor, who was another witness, and the victim were sitting.

[0] Testimony: Yeah, I loaned Elg cash. About 100,000 dollars.
[1] Testimony: That day, we was due to have a little chat. The kid had hit his payback date, see?

input.prefix: You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
input.evidence:
Evidence:
[0] Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

[1] Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.

[2] Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded.

[3] Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow.

[4] Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.

[5] Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. The victim is wearing a pair of metal glass. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.

[6] Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.

[7] Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.

[8] Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot. The balloon is empty. 

[9] Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.

[10] Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.

[11] Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.

[12] Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing.

[13] Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.

[14] Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.

[15] Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.

[16] Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.

[17] Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.

[18] Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.

[19] Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.
input.testimonies:
Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The corpse that went crashin' through the Crystal Tower had a broken neck.
[1] Testimony: I, I made a minor miscalculation in the angle of the beam projection, that's all! That was my mistake!
[2] Testimony: But the post-mortem examination revealed another injury. A fatal wound.
[3] Testimony: There was a lesion in his chest where he'd clearly been stabbed by somethin' sharp right in the heart!
[4] Testimony: So the victim was killed before he went anywhere. And this fella's the only one who could have done it!
[5] Testimony: The weapon the victim was stabbed with must have been left in his body whilst he was beamed through the air!
input.summarized_context:

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge

[1] Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.

[2] Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.

[3] Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.

[4] Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.

[5] Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]

[6] Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.

[7] Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.

[8] Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".

[9] Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".

[10] Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".

[11] Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.

[12] Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.

[13] Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.

[14] Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.

[15] Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.

[16] Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.

[17] Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.

[18] Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

The witness Atmey is describing his encounter with the thief Mask☆DeMasque.
input.suffix: Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
input.full_input:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.

Evidence:
[0] Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

[1] Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.

[2] Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.

[3] Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime.

[4] Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value.

[5] Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.

[6] Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.

[7] Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.

[8] Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.

[9] Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.

[10] Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.

[11] Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).

[12] Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used.

[13] Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.

[14] Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.

[15] Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.

[16] Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.

[17] Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.

[18] Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.

[19] Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.

[20] Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.

[21] Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.

[22] Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.


Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: Indeed, it's true that I looked away from the door for a brief moment.
[1] Testimony: However... Luke Atmey cannot be so easily discombobulated!
[2] Testimony: Unfortunately, the thief grabbed a weapon from the side and... rendered me senseless.
[3] Testimony: A true gentleman fights only with his own fists... But they were not enough.
[4] Testimony: His first blow struck true! Bam! ...And that's all she wrote.
[5] Testimony: I put my back to the wall to fight, but the thief's blow landed upon my third eye.

Summarized context:
The witness Atmey is describing his encounter with the thief Mask☆DeMasque.

Testimonies:
[0] Testimony: The truth is, I've been Mask☆DeMasque all along!
[1] Testimony: I mean, you can't prove that I'm not actually Mask☆DeMasque, can you?
[2] Testimony: I don't have an alibi for the night the urn was stolen, after all!
[3] Testimony: I donned my costume that night and dancingly descended upon the scene of the crime!

[5] Testimony: As for my broach, I snagged it on the door handle and it got torn off, that's all!

The witness Ron claims he is Mask☆DeMasque. He claims that he is indeed the thief and was at the Lordly Tailor shop when the crime happened. We know that Lordly Tailor is decently far away from any other location in this story.
